programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Shiralee Bed & Breakfast in Salisbury, run by Fay Lahiani and her partner Ray Cooper, where some guests are shocked by the colourful and cluttered decor, while the presence of CCTV cameras also causes concern.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At The Bluebell Woods in Northampton, David and Donna Bletsoe Brown try to bring a touch of class to their woodland B&B, but Fay Lahiani and Ray Cooper are on the warpath and are quick to discover a mucky mattress. Meanwhile, Marc Harris and Wayne Williams reveal their competitive streak during an afternoon of horse riding.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to The Lion Hotel in Pontypool for the third day of the contest, where manager Marc Harris and head chef Wayne Williams aim to deliver a high end service. Although some of the guests are impressed by the rooms, Ray and Fay find it too small for the price, and simmering tensions between some of the competitors leads to a clash over dinner. At breakfast, Wayne's food comes under fire, but it is David and Donna's feedback about finding a nail in their room that really rattles their hosts.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final guest house of the week is the New Inn, Talgarth, where ex-naval officer Damon Lewis is the sole captain of his ship. Wayne and Marc are determined to be brutally honest, and Donna and David are forced to work closely with their rivals Fay and Ray during an afternoon team-building exercise. Over dinner, Damon admits that taking on the B&B, pub and restaurant all by himself may have not been the best decision - as proved when he has trouble running a solo breakfast service.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time, with Fay and Ray from Shiralee B&B wanting to find out why David and Donna were so critical of their cleanliness. The group members continue to air their grievances as they find out what they've been paid, before the winner is revealed.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Michel Roux Jr is joined around the tasting table by First Dates maitre d' Fred Sirieix, food writer William Sitwell, baker and deli owner Stacie Stewart and TV presenter Lucy Alexander to put tea, croissants and barbecue pork ribs to the test. The quickfire public taste challenge involves rice pudding.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Andy Wirth - the CEO of a California ski resort - goes undercover to learn more about his company's working practices as he prepares to merge an existing operation with a new acquisition.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Jeff Platt, the President and CEO of entertainment and fitness business Sky Zone, poses as a contestant on a reality TV show who is trying to win an action-adventure holiday. He aims to discover whether his fast-growing company is running as smoothly and efficiently as possible, but his secret identity is jeopardised when he encounters a colleague he has met on a previous occasion.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Kat Cole goes undercover among the workforce of her company Cinnabon Incorporated, which serves sweet treats from more than 900 bakeries in 40 countries worldwide. Kat has come a long way after being raised by a single mother who fed her family of three girls on $10 a week. She seeks advice from her old boss, former Hooters CEO Coby Brooks, who also went undercover, in his own organisation. Kat has some lofty goals for Cinnabon to become a worldwide food brand, and wants to make sure that the new products she has put in place are working before she implements her plans.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Stephen J Cloobeck, chairman and CEO of hotel company Diamond Resorts International, becomes the first boss to go incognito at his own organisation for a second time.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: The CEO and chairman of in-store media provider Mood Media, Lorne Abony, goes undercover in one of the fastest growing companies in America. Adopting a disguise in his own business, he finds out how efficiently it is functioning.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for West Babylon, New York, to help the inexperienced owners of restaurant Classic American deal with their escalating debts. The chef struggles to cope with disorganised staff and an unappealing menu, but quickly realises the real problem lies in the kitchen, where a lack of leadership and communication is causing serious trouble.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to Connecticut's oldest inn, the Curtis House in Woodbury, which has been owned by the Hardisty family for generations. However, the business has started to fall apart and their legacy is on the brink of being lost. Siblings Chris and TJ, who are in charge, no longer speak to each other and the staff and guests feel stuck in the middle.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Pipestone, Minnesota, where he checks in to Historic Calumet Inn. Joint owners Vanda and Rina Smrkovski were given the hotel as a gift by their father, but after just nine months in charge, their staff are on the brink of revolt, and guests are expressing their dissatisfaction with the accommodation. Gordon quickly realises the sisters need to grow up fast if he's going to have a chance of saving the business. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A dachshund is brought in by owners Kelly and Daniel to see if anything can be done to repair a deformity in its foot, and Noel Fitzpatrick gives the one-year-old a lesson in doggy discipline along the way. A 10-month-old labrador needs a hip replacement before it can begin training as a medical-alert dog to help its owner with her rare health condition. An eight-year-old shih-tzu has the most extraordinary walk the vet has ever seen, but the operation to fix the dog's spine will be extremely risky, presenting the owners with an agonising decision.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The best and funniest moments from the recent series, including armchair TV reviews of Culinary Genius, Britain's Got Talent, Line of Duty, Cruising with Jane McDonald, University Challenge and First Dates. Plus, news reports featuring Diane Abbott, squirrels and young children gate-crashing a serious interview.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: The return of the programme following the emergency services, this time focusing on the work of the police, paramedics and fire service in Wiltshire. The first edition examines the rise in racially aggravated hate crimes, with the mother of a nine-year-old girl calling 999 to report that her daughter has been racially abused by two 11-year-olds while out playing. PC James Isaac arrests a 29-year-old man who targeted a 17-year-old white girl with text messages after coming across photos of her and her black boyfriend on Facebook.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An 80-year-old patient is admitted suffering from pain in her chest, arm and jaw, and consultant Sarah is concerned that Joan's heart is struggling and requests an urgent blood test and heart. Meanwhile a 26-year-old woman who fell and hit her head during a hen party in Ibiza complains about headaches, dizziness and vomiting, with doctors fearing she may have caused serious damage.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: First-time parents Rochalla and her unflappable partner Craig arrive 10 days overdue. Her shock pregnancy defied medical odds as she conceived just weeks after an aggressive course of chemotherapy. Cameras also follow train driver Kieron and his wife Joanne, who find it hard to kick their clockwatching habit during labour. While self-confessed ladies' man Michael and partner Natalia prepare for the arrival of her fourth child.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A dachshund is brought in by owners Kelly and Daniel to see if anything can be done to repair a deformity in its foot, and Noel Fitzpatrick gives the one-year-old a lesson in doggy discipline along the way. A 10-month-old labrador needs a hip replacement before it can begin training as a medical-alert dog to help its owner with her rare health condition. An eight-year-old shih-tzu has the most extraordinary walk the vet has ever seen, but the operation to fix the dog's spine will be extremely risky, presenting the owners with an agonising decision.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick and the team deal with two emergency cases in this edition. Lara the cat went missing after jumping into a removal van, but escaped, only to be hit by a car and then attacked by a fox. One of its rear legs is shattered and the vet has to perform reconstructive surgery to rebuild it. Chief, an eight-year-old Northern Inuit, dislocated its hip while chasing a fox. Noel thinks it needs hip-replacement surgery, but owner Nigel can't afford to pay for the operation.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of six potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 43-year-old Cathy from Hertfordshire who, with her biological clock ticking, is wanting to settle down and have children. The trouble is she's open to dating men from their 20s to their 60s and finds it hard to choose. Will she find it easier to pick the right partner when they're all naked? Then, 24-year-old Londoner Adam takes centre stage. He hates online dating and has decided to bare all in order to find the perfect match.(n)

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Comedians Sara Pascoe and John Cleese join Adam Hills, Alex Brooker and Josh Widdicombe to examine the biggest and most entertaining news stories and round up the main talking points of the week.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Mike and Amanda Gadd and their two children have always holidayed on the Algarve, a place that holds a special place in their hearts. Mike often works away with his job as a salesman, so they've decided to buy a holiday home there to give them a place to spend quality time together. Ben Hillman shows them five properties around their favourite town of Vilamoura for their £127,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman shows Warwickshire couple Lorraine and Neville Bulsara five holiday homes in the Spanish region of La Marina Alta within their budget of £160,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman shows a number of properties to newly engaged Glasgow couple Lyndsey and Paul, who want to buy a holiday home in the area around Oliva in eastern Spain.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies helps Cheshire couple Alison and Stephen Bulger find a holiday home in the charming town of Marseillan in the South of France for their £115,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Retired couple Stephen and Janis Pigeon from Buckinghamshire want to make a permanent move to the western Costa del Sol, with a budget of £150,000.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island. The no-nonsense chef struggles to persuade hot-headed owner Abby to make his suggested changes, and a confrontation results in him being thrown out of the building in the middle of a dinner service. The eatery's co-owner and financier begs Gordon to return, but his success hinges on his ability to win Abby over.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help prospective buyers in Wiltshire to find properties that meet their demands. Vicky and Andy's vastly different ideas of what they are looking for means one of them will have to back down, while house-hunters Malcolm and Jenny have spent four months searching on the internet without finding anything they like. They have only one requirement - the place must `give them a hug'.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Benefit Tenants
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of specialist letting agencies dealing with benefit tenants who have turned to private landlords. In Leeds, letting agent Aimee has received complaints about a bad smell and a high volume of bluebottles coming from one of her properties. For South Yorkshire agents Andrew and Allen, rent arrears have reached an all-time high, forcing them to come up with a controversial way to bring in more money.(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: The gang visits Vanstock, where Kelso finds himself in demand, while Red accompanies Kitty to her works party - and has plenty to talk about thanks to his new-found love of daytime television. Nostalgic comedy series, starring Mila Kunis, Topher Grace and Debra Jo Rupp.(n)

programme.title: 100 Per Cent Hotter
programme.desc: The team of fashion experts advise busy mum Daniella, who arrives in a red PVC number that leaves little to the imagination. They are also consulted by John, who admits that all creativity goes into his drag alter ego Ava, leaving himself looking drab and plain.(n)

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: Rory realises she is not cut out for casual dating and tells Logan she thinks they should go back to being friends, but he surprises her by suggesting they become a couple instead. Luke fills in as head chef, but a pregnant Sookie dislikes having someone else on her turf.(n)

programme.title: Gilmore Girls

programme.title: Getting Even with Dad
programme.desc: Spoilt child Timmy goes to live with his outwardly respectable father, but realises he is a small-time thief planning his latest robbery. Timmy sets out to reform his dad, and in the meantime manages to fix him up with an attractive undercover cop - leading to much confusion. Family comedy, starring Macaulay Culkin, Ted Danson, Glenne Headly and Hector Elizondo.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: After almost eight weeks, Emma Willis reveals the result of the public vote to choose the winner of Big Brother 2017. Whittling them down one by one, Emma leads the runners-up quickly through the best and worst of their time on Big Brother, until there is only one remaining. She chats to the winner about life in the house, why they think they have won and how it feels to be back in the outside world. There'll also be a roll-call of all the evictees from the series and a speedy look at what the housemates got up to yesterday. And fans needn't worry - the normal series may be over for another year, but Celebrity Big Brother promises to return soon. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: The agents try to recover more than £12,000 owed by a jeweller to one of his suppliers, but as the tension mounts, the debtor violently lashes out at one of the officers. Meanwhile, agents in London chase up more than £5,000 owed by a tenant to her former landlord for rent arrears, and also attempt to retrieve over £6,000 owed by a property developer.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: In West London, agents Max and Cona chase up more than £2,000 in unpaid parking fines, but when they try to seize a vehicle, the debtor ties it to a tree. Meanwhile in Lancashire, officers Stewart and Elmor try to collect £4,000 owed for unpaid nursery fees, and in Bedfordshire two agents must tackle a church ministry that owes over £8,000 in rent arrears.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: The agents chase £4,500 owed to a shipping company by a car parts dealer in Lancashire, but when the debtor arrives, he tries to assault one of the officers. Max and Steve are in east London on a mission to collect over £2,000 owed to a housing association, and Paul and Ben are in north London where they attempt to evict two tenants who owe more than £7,000 in rent arrears.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Officers Gary and Cona chase up nearly £50,000 in unpaid rent in south-east London, but the debtor initially refuses to open the door. Meanwhile, Del and Max bid to collect more than £10,000 from a beauty salon for a disgruntled former employee in west London, and in Kent, Gary and Cona deal with a hostile situation when a couple refuse to pay the £2,000 they owe in unpaid rent arrears.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on the experiences of welfare claimants in relationships. They include Essex couple Suzanne and Derek, who are looking to move to avoid paying bedroom tax on their four-bedroom home. But finding a property to meet Suzanne's exacting standards is proving tricky. Meanwhile, epilepsy sufferer Stephan and his wife Linda are deep in debt but still spend £12 a week feeding the homeless, and Carl and Angie's benefits are affected by his disability allowance and her wages from a part-time job.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: The documentary series focuses on former members of the armed forces. Nigel left the Army in 1997, having served tours in Bosnia and Northern Ireland. He has been struggling to adapt to civilian life ever since and now runs a support group for others in a similar situation. Andrew was a Royal Navy engineer and now lives in Truro, but has had to stop working due to chronic breathing difficulties, and Anthony, who left the Duke of Lancaster regiment after standing on an IED, is now hoping for ground-breaking treatment to help him walk again.(n)

programme.title: Parker
programme.desc: A thief is betrayed and left for dead by his partners in crime. He learns they are planning a diamond heist in a wealthy neighbourhood, so poses as a millionaire wanting to buy a house in the area. A real-estate agent sees through the disguise and helps him get even by stealing the gems from his traitorous gang. Action thriller, with Jason Statham and Jennifer Lopez.(n)

programme.title: The Other Guys
programme.desc: Two desk-bound incompetent cops live in the shadow of their more daring colleagues. However, when the heroes of the station are killed in a bizarre accident, the bumbling duo get the chance to prove their worth as they stumble across a tycoon's illegal activities. Action comedy, starring Will Ferrell, Mark Wahlberg, Steve Coogan and Eva Mendes.(n)

programme.title: The Hand that Rocks the Cradle
programme.desc: Curtis Hanson's suburban horror story stars Rebecca De Mornay as Peyton, an unstable woman who takes a job as a nanny in order to exact revenge on her employers(n)

programme.title: Gone in 60 Seconds
programme.desc: A car thief is forced out of retirement to save his brother from gangsters(n)

programme.title: Scent of a Woman
programme.desc: Driven by an extravagant, tour-de-force performance by Al Pacino, Scent of a Woman is the story of Frank Slade (Pacino), a blind, retired army colonel who hires Charlie Simms (Chris O'Donnell), a poor college student on the verge of expulsion, to take care of him over Thanksgiving weekend. At the beginning of the weekend, Frank takes Charlie to New York, where he reveals to the student that he intends to visit his family, have a few terrific meals, sleep with a beautiful woman and, finally, commit suicide. The film follows the mis-matched pair over the course of the weekend, as they learn about life through their series of adventures. Though the story is a little contrived and predictable, it pulls all the right strings, thanks to O'Donnell's sympathetic supporting role and Pacino's powerful lead performance, for which he won his first Academy Award. Scent of a Woman is based on the 1975 Italian film Profumo Di Donna(n)

programme.title: Sea of Love
programme.desc: Highly charged erotic thriller about a weary New York cop's attempts to hunt down a brutal serial killer. The clues in the case point to a female stalker who answers lonely hearts ads, so the cop plants an ad and dates the respondents. One of the women becomes his prime suspect but also leads him into an obsessive, torrid affair. His judgment clouded, he is unable to stop agonising: did she or didn't she?(n)

programme.title: Stealing Beauty
programme.desc: Nineteen-year-old American Lucy arrives in Tuscany to visit her dead mother's friends... and to lose her virginity. Erotic drama from the director of Last Tango In Paris(n)

programme.title: The Express
programme.desc: Rob Brown gives a stellar performance in this winning fact-based sports biopic. He plays Syracuse University running back Ernie Davis, the first African-American to win the Heisman Trophy as the outstanding college-football player in the nation in 1961. Dennis Quaid costars as Syracuse coach Ben Schwartzwalder. Directed by Gary Fleder. The screenplay is by Charles Leavitt, who based it on the book "Ernie Davis: The Elmira Express," written by Syracuse alumnus Robert C. Gallagher(n)

programme.title: Bad Santa
programme.desc: Billy Bob Thornton is hilarious in this deliciously warped holiday comedy from director Terry Zwigoff ("Ghost World"). Thornton plays a vulgar, boozy con artist who robs the department stores where he works as St. Nick(n)

programme.title: The Wedding Singer
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a failed songwriter-turned-singer who makes a living on the wedding circuit in the 1980s. After being jilted at his own wedding, he becomes disillusioned about romance, but his spirits are soon lifted by a waitress who works at the same events(n)

programme.title: The Family Man
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage discovers that it's a wonderful life in this touching comic fantasy. He plays a rich, ruthless businessman who's shown the life he might have had by a guardian angel (Don Cheadle) who transforms him into a suburban working stiff with a wife (Tea Leoni), kids and minivan. Brett Ratner directed. Jeremy Piven, Saul Rubinek, Josef Sommer, Makenzie Vega(n)

programme.title: Cocktail
programme.desc: Dramatic tale of a college drop-out who sets off on the road to fortune working in an upmarket Manhattan bar where he teams up with a flashy barman. But their partnership disintegrates when they fall out over a woman(n)

programme.title: Fred Claus
programme.desc: Fred Claus, Santa's bitter older brother, is forced to move to the North Pole(n)

programme.title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
programme.desc: Mike Myers is back as the self-styled sexiest spy in the world in this achingly funny sequel. This time Austin goes back to the 60s to trap his nemesis, Dr Evil - but Evil's not the only adversary he must face this time. There's also Evil's scaled-down accomplice Mini-Me, not to mention the grotesque Fat Bastard. Heather Graham co-stars as Austin's squeeze this time around, although there's a blink-and-you'll-miss-it reappearance by Liz Hurley from the first movie and additional appearances from the likes of Robert Wagner and Rob Lowe(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man
programme.desc: When bitten by a genetically modified spider, a nerdy, shy, and awkward high school student gains spider-like abilities that he eventually must use to fight evil as a superhero after tragedy befalls his family(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man 2
programme.desc: The story revolves around Peter Parker, a disguised super hero who has to stop Otto Octavius, an evil scientist, who is on a mission to avenge his wife's death(n)

programme.title: The Revenant
programme.desc: In 1820s America, frontiersman and fur trapper Hugh Glass (Leonardo DiCaprio) and his teenage son Hawk (Forrest Goodluck) join a pelt-gathering expedition. However, their party are attacked by Arikara Native Americans, who kill a number of the men. Glass then tries to lead the remainder of the group to safety, charting a new path to a U.S. fort. Unfortunately, he is soon mauled by a grizzly bear while hunting for food, and is horribly wounded. He is left in the care of roughneck John Fitzgerald (Tom Hardy) and the young and inexperienced Jim Bridger (Will Poulter), while Hawk watches on in horror. Fitzgerald betrays him and leaves him buried alive in a shallow grave, but Glass nurses himself back to health and sets out to seek revenge. Alejandro González Iñárritu directed this pulse-pounding epic(n)

programme.title: Trapped
programme.desc: In this tense thriller, a young girl with asthma is kidnapped and held for ransom, but her captors tell her parents that they'll deprive the child of her medication unless they comply with their terms, one of which is not to contact the police(n)

programme.title: The Rookie
programme.desc: Nick Pulovski is a cop, presently assigned to the auto theft division. When he discovers that a man named Strom is the brains behind a major car theft and chop shop ring, he sees this as his opportunity to do something big. After his partner is killed, the case is then transferred to homicide, so he is taken off the case. And he is assigned a new partner, a cop who would prefer to play by the rules(n)

programme.title: Dark Water
programme.desc: Dahlia and daughter Ceci are happy in their New York apartment until stagnant water begins to seep through the roof. Is someone - or something - living upstairs? Psychological horror from the author of The Ring(n)

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: A scientist survives a mankind-destroying virus and struggles to live in a New York City overflowing with cannibalistic zombies that come out only at night. Based on the 1954 sci-fi classic novel by Richard Matheson(n)

programme.title: Michael Clayton
programme.desc: A burned-out "fixer" at a powerful corporate law firm in New York City who faces a crisis of conscience(n)

programme.title: The Pianist
programme.desc: Gripping Holocaust biopic with Adrien Brody as a gifted Polish-Jewish musician struggling to survive in the Warsaw ghetto. Brody dropped about 30 pounds to affect the emaciated look of a starving man. Roman Polanski scored Best Director. As a Jewish youngster in 1939 Krakow, Polanski witnessed the Nazi invasion. It's his first film shot in his native Poland since 1962's "Knife in the Water," his feature-film debut(n)

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club
programme.desc: The true story of Texas electrician Ron Woodroof, who was diagnosed as HIV positive in 1986, and subsequently devoted his life to providing unapproved drugs and supplements to fellow HIV patients during an era when doctors were still struggling to understand the virus(n)

programme.title: The Dreamers
programme.desc: The tumultuous political landscape of Paris in 1968 serves as the backdrop for a tale about three young cinema lovers who are drawn together through their passion for film. Matthew, an American exchange student, pursuing his education abroad in Paris, becomes friends with a French brother and sister duo, named Theo and Isabelle, who share a common love of the cinema. While the May 1968 Paris student riots--which eventually shut down most of the French government--are happening around them, the three friends develop a relationship unlike anything Matthew has ever experienced, or will ever encounter again(n)

programme.title: Changing Lanes
programme.desc: (2002) Ben Affleck plays well-heeled lawyer Gavin Banek dashing to a meeting; while Samuel L Jackson takes the role of Doyle Gipson, an estranged husband on his way to a child custody hearing. When the pair's cars collide in a minor accident, Banek dashes off a cheque and leaves, little knowing he's accidentally taken a document crucial to Gipson's hearing that sees him lose the case. But Gipson has an equally vital document belonging to Banek and so begins a battle of wills and wits in Roger Michell's fast-moving thriller(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Catch a Contractor
programme.desc: Adam Carolla acts as a vigilante watchdog for homeowners and businesses that have been cheated by contractors and left with unfinished construction disasters.(n)

programme.title: Killer Collector
programme.desc: Two women at an auction unwittingly purchase a storage locker belonging to a serial killer that contains evidence of his crimes. They soon find themselves in a desperate race to uncover the truth before the murderer tracks them down. Thriller, directed by and starring Casper Van Dien, with Samantha Cope and Cassi Thomson.(n)

programme.title: Oliver's Ghost
programme.desc: A boy with the ability to see ghosts moves to a new house, to find it is haunted by a bad-tempered phantom who does not take kindly to intruders in his home. The youngster tries to win him over and help him come to terms with the unresolved issues of his life. Fantasy, starring Nicholas Stargel, Martin Mull and Rhea Perlman.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Swan Song
programme.desc: A country singer arranges for his wife and his underage lover to both die in a phoney plane crash after his spouse diverts all his money to her religious causes in revenge for his affair. He is confident he remains above suspicion, but Columbo realises something does not add up and sets out to wrest a confession from the musician. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Johnny Cash and Ida Lupino.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The shooting of a petty officer looks like an open-and-shut case when a Russian man is found with a recently fired gun in his car. However, the investigation takes a dramatic turn when it is revealed he is working as a spy for the Department of Homeland Security. Military crime drama, with Mark Harmon, Cote de Pablo and David McCallum.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a lance corporal, whose body has been found in an empty house, and discovers he had a number of spurned lovers and a $2million inheritance. Ducky and Gibbs interview one of the dead marine's partners, but disagree over whether she is telling the truth. David McCallum and Mark Harmon star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Kidnappers strike on Halloween, wounding a marine sergeant and snatching his daughter - leaving the team members wondering why anyone would try to extort money from someone on such a modest salary. As the agents begin searching for a motive, Abby surprises everyone by turning up at the lab in a revealing fancy-dress costume.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team joins forces with military investigators to ascertain whether terrorists were responsible for an explosion at a golf course in which a marine colonel was killed. As inquiries proceed, McGee has to use his computer skills to break into secret government files to ensure the murderers are apprehended. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A former marine falls to his death from a hotel balcony, and investigations quickly lead to the discovery of another body. As Gibbs and the team dig deeper, they uncover evidence that points to the activities of a vice ring trafficking young girls. Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen and Sam pose as traffic cops to infiltrate a gang of corrupt officers and military personnel who have been allowing smugglers and criminals a safe passage. Unfortunately, just as they are on the verge of solving the case, the group's leader is shot dead.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The Big Easy's annual Red Dress Run is brought to an abrupt halt when participants discover a body on route. Luckily, the NCIS team is competing in the race, and is on hand to investigate. The victim is identified as petty officer Kelsey Weaver, who was last seen running though the city, shouting that she was being pursued by a man with a gun. CCTV footage shows no signs of Weaver's apparent assailant, but when toxicology reports reveal the dead woman had traces of a hallucinogenic drug in her system, Pride and his colleagues are drawn into the battle to stop the spread of this new narcotic substance. Naval crime drama, starring Scott Bakula.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Two US Navy foremen are murdered at a Naval Branch health clinic, and with a little help from Brody's mother Olivia, the team discovers the two dead men had been tasked with delivering a heart for a transplant operation. The planned recipient was a skilled Dapra programmer with a rare blood type, but the killers made sure to ruin the procedure by putting a bullet through the organ before making their escape. However, when the heart in question turns out to be a decoy, the team begins to suspect the culprits may have stolen the real one for a criminal with a heart defect from the FBI's most wanted list. Naval crime drama, guest starring Annie Potts (Ghostbusters).(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A CIA agent's fiancee is raped and murdered by a professional hitman, suggesting an assassination, but the detectives suspect a man resembling the victim's partner could have invented the story to cover up an affair. Crime drama, guest starring Dylan Walsh (Nip/Tuck), with Christopher Meloni.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A boy's mutilated body is found in a basement, raising suspicions that he fell victim to a sex offender living in the area. However, another youngster later alleges he died accidentally during an illegal fight club bout - leading Benson and Stabler to an unexpected discovery. Crime drama, starring Christopher Meloni.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The son of Fin's ex-wife stands trial for the rape and murder of a woman and her baby but, after having had the first case revoked, his lawyer tries to get him off the charges again by discrediting the SVU. Benson, Fin and Stabler are ordered to appear as witnesses for the defence in court, where questionable past decisions come back to haunt them. Guest starring Chris `Ludacris' Bridges.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler investigate a case of alleged child abuse, but soon realise their attention should actually be focused on the woman who made the report. Hard-hitting drama, starring Christopher Meloni, Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler investigate a rape case involving a girl and her older sister's boyfriend, but when questioned, the suspect claims he committed the crime in his sleep. When a tip-off leads the detectives to a popular online game, they discover what happened to the victim's older sibling, who mysteriously disappeared. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay and Christopher Meloni.(n)

programme.title: Love You to Death
programme.desc: Premiere. An attorney freezes in court, and her mistake allows a murderer go free. Ordered to take a sabbatical, Yasmine returns to her home town, ostensibly to spend time with her daughter and sister, but secretly planning to rebuild the case. However, such intentions are scuppered when the man she inadvertently set free shows up vowing retribution. Thriller, starring Bree Williamson and Emilija Baranac.(n)

programme.title: Dear Diary, I Died

programme.title: Columbo: Mind Over Mayhem
programme.desc: A scientist is overjoyed when his son follows in his footsteps, receiving widespread acclaim for a revolutionary new theory. When a fellow boffin produces evidence of plagiarism, the ruthless father resorts to murder to save his son from a scandal. But he reckons without the dishevelled detective, who sees through his efforts to make the killing look like the work of burglars. Crime drama, with Peter Falk, Jose Ferrer and Lew Ayres.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Prescription Murder
programme.desc: A psychiatrist having an affair with a patient murders his wife with his lover's help. However, while he establishes the perfect alibi he soon finds himself pursued by Columbo, whose meandering investigative approach conceals an uncanny gift for detection. First episode of the detective series, starring Peter Falk and Gene Barry.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Etude in Black
programme.desc: An orchestra conductor murders his mistress for threatening to reveal their affair, and makes her death look like suicide. However, he reckons without the intervention of crumpled cop Columbo, who sees through the subterfuge and determines to get to the truth. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, John Cassavetes, Myrna Loy and Blythe Danner.(n)

programme.desc: Part two of two. Sam, Callen and the rest of the team make their way through Frank's list, tracking down the remaining sleeper agents hiding in America's seven largest cities. But when raids recover no nuclear bombs, they draw a blank - until a Russian arms dealer makes it known he has three nukes for sale on the black market. Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J star.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.sub-title: The CSI Movie: Dr Who & Mr Jekyll.
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Langston's colleagues begin to suspect he may be responsible for the murder of a journalist when they learn the victim was planning to write a story accusing him of working alongside a serial killer. Their suspicions seem to be confirmed when Wendy reveals she observed him behaving strangely in recent months, while Catherine and Nick investigate his unconvincing alibi.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: An accusation that a teacher coerced a 15-year-old student into having sex with her is met with the counterclaim by the now-pregnant woman that she was raped. Huang's suggestion that a personality disorder drew her to the youngster is undermined by incriminating evidence that casts new light on the case. Guest starring Melissa Joan Hart (Sabrina the Teenage Witch).(n)

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia(n)

programme.desc: A detective's probe into the murder of four cops points to corruption and his own brother and brother-in-law, both of whom are cops(n)

programme.title: The Forest
programme.desc: Set in the Aokigahara Forest, which is a place where people commit suicides, a young American woman, Sara, is in search of her twin sister, who has mysteriously disappeared in the forest. Despite the warnings from the villagers, Sara travels into the ghost-filled forest to save her sister to discover the truth while being confronted by angry and tormented souls of the dead that prey on anyone who crosses their paths(n)

programme.title: Alien: The Director's Cut
programme.desc: The crew of a spacecraft fight off a terrifying extra-terrestrial invader in Ridley Scott's cut of his sci-fi classic(n)

programme.title: Pitch Black
programme.desc: When a spaceship suffers mechanical failure and is forced to land on an alien world, its passengers' attempts to escape are hindered by ravenous nocturnal monsters. With the planet basking in sunlight, the group feel safe in the knowledge that the creatures can only survive in the dark. But a rare total eclipse is imminent, and so a battle between man and beast begins(n)

programme.title: Cursed
programme.desc: The team behind the Scream trilogy, director Wes Craven and screenwriter Kevin Williamson, present another entry in the teen-horror genre with Cursed. Starring Christina Ricci and Jesse Eisenberg, the film tells the story of two siblings who have to battle a werewolf that has been wreaking havoc on their neighbors, just as they learn that they might be marked with "the sign of the beast," and may become werewolves themselves. Along with Shannon Elizabeth and Judy Greer, Cursed also co-stars Dawson Creek alumnus Joshua Jackson, as well as R&B star Mya(n)

programme.title: The Box
programme.desc: Arthur and Norma Lewis receive a mysterious box that will grant them $1 million if they push the button inside, but they must debate if that's worth the consequence of killing a random person(n)

programme.title: Alien 3
programme.desc: Nerve-jangling sci-fi horror. After answering a distress signal from a long-dead planet, the crew of a deep-space freighter returning to Earth unwittingly bring aboard a murderous life form that goes on a gruesome rampage. A masterpiece of suspense - taking a B-movie plot and adding benchmark production values, including Swiss surrealist H R Giger's nightmarish designs - the film won an Oscar for its startling visual effects(n)

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: Ron Howard helms this adaptation of Nathaniel Philbrick's historical novel about the harrowing high-seas encounter that inspired Herman Melville's Moby Dick. In the winter of 1820, the crew of the New England whaling ship the Essex struggle to survive after an attack by a rogue sperm whale leaves them stranded at sea for 90 days. Chris Hemsworth, Cillian Murphy, Ben Whishaw, and Brendan Gleeson co-star(n)

programme.title: Play It to the Bone
programme.desc: Boxing comedy drama about two ageing fighters who never made the big time but remain good friends. When an undercard bout in Las Vegas is cancelled at short notice, they are asked to step in. Unfortunately, they have to fight each other(n)

programme.title: Enter the Dragon
programme.desc: Bruce Lee uses a martial arts tournament as the pretext to infiltrate the island fortress of a one-armed drug baron. Forget the story, watch the moves(n)

programme.title: Any Given Sunday
programme.desc: 'On any given Sunday you're gonna win or you're gonna lose. The point is - can you win or lose like a man?' Macho stuff from director Oliver Stone, with a cast of heavyweights from both cinema and pro sport(n)

programme.title: Everest
programme.desc: In this adventure docudrama set in 1996, several groups of climbers successfully scale Mount Everest, only to be faced with tragedy when a monster snowstorm surprises them as they attempt to make their descent(n)

programme.title: The Amityville Horror
programme.desc: In this terrifying remake, a couple think they've found a dream house in Amityville, Long Island, but they soon learn that the home has a dark history. A year before, a man living in the house murdered his family in their sleep, claiming he was commanded to commit the crime by demons(n)

programme.title: Alien Resurrection
programme.desc: 200 years after the conclusion of Alien 3, the company is able to resurrect Ripley through the process of cloning and the scientists successfully take the Queen Alien out of her. But, Ripley's DNA gets mixed-up with the Queen's and she begins to develop certain alien characteristics. The scientists begin breeding the aliens, but they later escape. Soon the Xeno-morphs are running amok on the ship, which is on course to earth. The Queen then gives birth to a deadly new breed of alien, which could spell disaster for the entire human race. It's up to Ripley and a band of space pirates to stop the ship before it reaches earth. Starring Sigourney Weaver, Winona Ryder and Dominique Pinon(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves
programme.desc: Romantic action adventure based on the legendary nobleman-turned-outlaw. On his return from the Crusades, the rebel learns that his father has been murdered by the tyrannical Sheriff of Nottingham and embarks on a campaign of guerrilla warfare to protect the King's throne. The outlaw counts upon the support of his band of followers, including his Moorish companion, a drunken priest and the beautiful Maid Marian(n)

programme.title: Constantine

programme.title: Bounty Hunters of the Old West

programme.title: World War II in Color
programme.desc: The Gathering Storm. Documentary telling the full story of World War II with the aid of rare and unseen archive footage, recently released official documents, modern colourisation techniques, state-of-the-art satellite-delivered terrain mapping and graphics. In the run-up to September 1939, political and economic chaos in the aftermath of World War I allowed Hitler in Germany, Mussolini in Italy and ultra-nationalists in imperial Japan to seize absolute power. When Britain, France and the United States failed to confront initial acts of aggression, contempt for their weakness prompted Germany and Italy to intervene in the civil war in Spain and Hitler to make a series of land grabs which brought Europe to the brink of war. Ep. 1 (Followed by News)(n)

programme.desc: Donal Skehan takes on hosting duties this weekend, as Greg James joins him in the studio kitchen to sample dishes prepared by chefs Glyn Purnell and Jose Pizarro.(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's British Food Adventure
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain explores the culinary traditions of the Peak District and surrounding areas, beginning by putting her own twist on the classic Bakewell tart. She then joins Ian Barrett to learn how to make Derbyshire oatcakes, before using them as a casing for her potato and dill samosas.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The teams head to Oswestry in Shropshire, where experts Jonathan Pratt and David Harper are on hand to assist in the search for treasures. Meanwhile, presenter Tim Wonnacott visits Cotehele House in Calstock, Cornwall, and looks at a fascinating time-teller.(n)

programme.title: Brendan Foster: A Life in Athletics
programme.desc: An insight into the career of the broadcaster and former athlete, who won gold as a long distance runner at the European Championships and Commonwealth Games in the 1970s, before going on to become a commentator. Foster has covered nine Olympic Games during his time with the BBC, and is due to retire following the IAAF World Championships, which begin on Friday.(n)

programme.title: Live Challenge Cup Rugby League
programme.desc: Hull FC v Leeds Rhinos (Kick-off 2.30pm). Tanya Arnold presents coverage of the opening semi-final, which takes place at Keepmoat Stadium in Doncaster. The Black and Whites are the reigning champions following their victory over Warrington Wolves in last year's final, and they are looking to reach consecutive finals for the first time since the 1980s. The Rhinos have been one of the dominant forces in this competition in recent times, appearing in the final in five of the last seven seasons, and lifting the trophy in both 2014 and 2015 with wins over Castleford Tigers and Hull Kingston Rovers.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: The team values antiques in Gloucester, as experts Catherine Southon and Michael Baggott examine a rare cameo lava brooch from Mount Vesuvius, and a Tibetan ceremonial instrument made from a human leg bone. Plus, Paul Martin meets the young choristers who are following a 500-year-old tradition singing in the cathedral choir.(n)

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
programme.desc: A cabaret singer who once hid out in a convent is reunited with the nuns she befriended, who now need her help. She poses as a member of the order once more and joins the staff of a Catholic school threatened with closure, where she aims to make a success of the resident choir. Comedy sequel, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Kathy Najimy, Lauryn Hill, Maggie Smith and James Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: A sporting-themed edition of the show, featuring snooker commentator Willie Thorne and former golfer Tony Jacklin, darts stars Andy Fordham and Deta Hedman, ex-athletes Tessa Sanderson and Derek Redmond, and rugby union international Nick Easter and former rugby winger Martin Offiah. Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present.(n)

programme.title: Would I Lie to You
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by Radio 1 DJ Clara Amfo, actor Tom Davis, actor and musician Shaun Ryder and comedian Henning Wehn, aiming to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: Who Dares Wins
programme.desc: Nick Knowles's game show returns after a two-month break to challenges another selection of complete strangers to team up, with each pair battling to outdo the other by listing as much as they know about a given subject. The first couple to win two rounds get to play for £50,000 and each time the champions defeat a new set of opponents their winnings mount up.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Paul Unwin, the man who co-created Casualty back in 1986, returns as a guest writer for an episode that covers the span of an hour within Holby's Emergency Department. Duffy has her hands full as she is shadowed by a pair of school-girls planning to enter the medical profession, and Jez is crippled by guilt after he manages to rescue a woman from a house fire, but did not realise he saved her at the expense of her baby. Meanwhile, Ethan throws himself into his work following the incident with Scott, and when the ailing leader of a marching band arrives feeling unwell, Louise is forced to leave him in triage, with disastrous consequences. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull
programme.desc: The globe-trotting archaeologist teams up with a rebellious teenager who draws him into a search in the Amazon jungle for a mysterious artefact of untold power. But their quest is hindered by Soviet agents, who also want the fabled object for an altogether more sinister purpose. Action adventure sequel, updating the series to a Cold War setting, starring Harrison Ford, Cate Blanchett, Shia LaBeouf, Ray Winstone and John Hurt.(n)

programme.title: When in Rome
programme.desc: A single-minded career woman attends her sister's wedding in Italy and, tired of being unlucky in love, impulsively snatches a handful of coins from the supposedly magical Fountain of Love. When she returns to New York, she suddenly finds herself pursued by a host of potential suitors, but each serves only to keep her from the man of her dreams. Romantic comedy, starring Kristen Bell, Josh Duhamel, Anjelica Huston, Will Arnett, Jon Heder and Dax Shepard.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Emma Barnett present topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers.(n)

programme.title: Live Cycling
programme.desc: Live coverage of the Prudential RideLondon-Surrey 100 and 46 Sportives, as the first finishers are expected to cross the finish line on The Mall in central London. Plus, a look at some of the stories of those involved in this year's race, and a look ahead to this afternoon's Prudential RideLondon-Surrey Classic.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Hour-long edition in which two teams of former navy boys do battle in the Cheshire town of Congleton, helped by experts Jonathan Pratt and David Harper. Plus, Tim Wonnacott carries on the military theme by paying a visit to the Royal Artillery Museum in London.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a house in Congleton in Cheshire, a one bedroom flat in Willesden in north-west London and a former ambulance station in Port Talbot in Wales before they are sold at auction. Next, they meet their new owners and find out their plans for the properties, before checking up on their progress at a later date.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a self-confessed city-lover find a Gloucestershire home for £850,000 or less where she can raise her young son.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Aled Jones is at Southwark Cathedral. Josie D'Arby discovers how the Salvation Army supports the emergency services and the UK's youngest black vicar gives his first service.(n)

programme.title: Live Cycling
programme.desc: Live coverage of the Prudential RideLondon-Surrey Classic, which involves a 200km course that starts and ends in London. This race has been granted UCI WorldTour event status for the first time, and as such a number of the world's top one-day cyclists are expected to be in attendance, including Andre Greipel, Mat Hayman, Jasper Stuyven and Lars Boom. Coverage begins on the interactive service from 1.50pm.(n)

programme.title: Wild Alaska Live
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin, Matt Baker and Steve Backshall conclude the coverage of Alaskan wildlife during the summer. The programme features footage of black bear cubs trying to catch enough food to make it through the winter, wolves competing with brown bears for the best fishing positions, orcas and humpback whales gathering at sea, and eagles hunting as the salmon complete their migration. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: A look at green spaces and wildlife in urban areas. Anita Rani visits a haven for animals in Stoke Newington, and helps an urban photographer track a pair of nesting common terns. Sean Fletcher joins Manchester airport's environment team, James Wong meets Liverpool residents growing vegetables on their roofs, Tom Heap investigates air pollution, and Adam Henson meets former services personnel rebuilding their lives through farming.(n)

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: Ross is determined to ensure that George loses in the election, and resolves to make up for some of Trenwith's neglect - he also becomes aware of Hugh's feelings for Demelza as he returns to Nampara to find them together. George is consumed with paranoia as he challenges Dwight over Valentine's legitimacy and drives Elizabeth away. Rowella attempts to seduce Whitworth, who receives advice from Dwight over his relationship with Morwenna, Lord Falmouth learns that the Warleggans will be standing against him, and Sam pines over Emma.(n)

programme.title: The Heroes of Super Saturday: Jess, Mo & Greg
programme.desc: Michael Johnson takes a look back at the day of competition known as `Super Saturday' at the 2012 Olympic Games, focusing on Jessica Ennis-Hill, Mo Farah and Greg Rutherford. The former American athlete also meets up with each of the British stars to discuss what happened in their respective careers after that momentous day, as well as looking ahead to what the next generation of stars can expect as they head into the World Athletics Championships, beginning on Friday.(n)

programme.title: The Peacemaker
programme.desc: A military intelligence officer and a government expert on nuclear weapons team up to find the terrorists who have stolen ten atomic bombs from a train. The duo are initially reluctant to co-operate, but a grudging respect gradually develops after they are forced to work together. Action thriller, starring George Clooney, Nicole Kidman, Marcel lures and Armin Mueller-Stahl.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: When a new artificial intelligence running the sub prevents the Nektons from saving a kayaker because it is too dangerous, Ant must outwit AIMY and save the day.(n)

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: The object Will and Ant are retrieving from the deepest part of the ocean is not what they expected - and now there is a stowaway on the Aronnax trying to take control of it.(n)

programme.title: Herbie Goes to Monte Carlo
programme.desc: The adventurous Volkswagen Beetle is entered in the Trans-Europa race from Paris to Monte Carlo. However, he causes chaos for his driver and mechanic when he falls in love with a rival car, whose owner is unaware her vehicle is alive. Meanwhile, a pair of slippery jewel thieves have secreted their loot in Herbie's petrol tank. Disney comedy adventure sequel, starring Dean Jones, Roy Kinnear, Don Knotts and Julie Sommars.(n)

programme.title: Mars Needs Moms
programme.desc: A nine-year-old boy sees a spacecraft land and kidnap his mother. He stows away on board as the ship travels back to the aliens' Mars homeland. As he tries to rescue her, he learns the Martians have taken her because they need Earth mothers to raise their own children. Animated sci-fi adventure, with the voices of Seth Robert Dusky, Dan Fogler and Joan Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Monty Halls' Great Irish Escape
programme.desc: As his time as a volunteer comes to an end, Monty Halls tries to retrieve an acoustic listening device holding vital data for the project from the seabed. However, when he fails to find the recording equipment, he realises all his hard work during the past six months might have been wasted. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a terraced house in New Haughton, Derbyshire and a large former care home in Bucknall, Stoke-on-Trent. They then discover what the buyers' paid for the properties and what their plans are for the buildings.(n)

programme.title: Nigel and Adam's Farm Kitchen
programme.desc: In the second edition, Nigel Slater and Adam Henson aim to reintroduce the notion of seasonality, something that has largely disappeared now that imports and technology mean people can buy what they want all year round. They use spring lamb, a meat that has become increasingly expensive over the years, with Nigel rescuing the cheaper cuts to show they can be just as tasty. Meanwhile, Adam hopes his wheat will have survived after the coldest spring for 50 years.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Natural World: Jungle Gremlins of Java.
programme.desc: Primatologist Dr Anna Nekaris travels to the Indonesian island of Java to investigate the slow loris, a creature often considered cute, but possessing a deadly toxic bite unusual in a primate. Heading deeper into the jungle to find out more about its lethal capabilities, she makes a surprising discovery.(n)

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: New series. John Humphrys and the famous black chair return for another season of the specialist and general knowledge quiz, as the first batch of 96 contenders start the long journey towards the final. Needless to say, only one can ultimately be crowned Mastermind Champion.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the second of the student quiz's first-round matches, four students from Trinity College, Cambridge, pit their wits against a team from the University of Bristol in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: New series. Victoria Coren Mitchell returns with the quiz show as further teams of three people use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between four things that may appear at first not to be linked, hoping to succeed reigning champions the Verbivores. Typical rounds they need to negotiate are termed connections, sequences, connecting wall and missing vowels. In this opening edition of the 13th series, three Tolkien fans take on a church team, with one set of clues consisting of pat: bone, rub: disease, nut: spread and salmon: bacteria.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes steps to ensure that fruits and vegetables give maximum cropping by dispensing advice on the summer pruning of fruit trees as well as revealing how to get the best from tomatoes and chillies. He also recommends plants that will carry on flowering into the autumn. Carol Klein meets writer Roy Lancaster as he reminisces on his life. Roy is a former Gardeners' World presenter, and with the programme's half-centenary in mind Rachel de Thame reflects on how people used to garden 50 years ago. Plus, Joe Swift and Flo Headlam help a community create a garden in Wiltshire. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Jessica Ennis-Hill and the Next Generation
programme.desc: The former Olympic heptathlon champion profiles some of the future stars of British athletics, ahead of the IAAF World Championships, which begin on Friday. In addition to meeting hammer thrower Sophie Hitchon, middle distance runner Laura Muir, 110m hurdler Andy Pozzi, sprinter Nethaneel Mitchell-Blake and marathon runner Josh Griffiths, Ennis-Hill discusses the expectation and scrutiny placed on sports stars, and reveals what it can be like to deal with pressure in and out of the sporting arena.(n)

programme.title: Live Swimming: World Championships
programme.desc: Helen Skelton presents coverage of day seven from Danube Arena in Budapest, Hungary, which will include the final of the men's 4x100m freestyle relay discipline, as well as the women's 800m freestyle event. With expert analysis from Rebecca Adlington and Mark Foster. Coverage continues on the interactive service.(n)

programme.title: Live Cycling
programme.desc: Live coverage of the Prudential RideLondon Classique, which takes place on a 5.5km circuit in central London, taking in some of the city's most famous landmarks. Great Britain's Laura Trott won the inaugural staging of this race in 2013, while Kirsten Wild of the Netherlands claimed victory in the most recent race 12 months ago. Coverage is available on the interactive service from 5.00pm.(n)

programme.title: Proms Extra
programme.desc: Katie Derham hosts another look back at highlights from the past week's performances. This evening, she turns her attention to Walton's Facade from the Malcolm Sargent Prom, and celebrates the work of British composer Scott Walker. Plus, David Owen Norris shares his Chord of the Week.(n)

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland
programme.sub-title: Scotland in Miniature: The Isle of Arran.
programme.desc: Paul Murton relives the golden days of Scottish tourism, beginning with a visit to the Isle of Arran. Known as `Scotland in miniature', the diverse destination has something for everyone - ruined castles, rugged mountains, stunning wildlife and even a nudist beach. Along the way he visits King's Cave, Lochranza, Brodick Castle and Kildonan before ending his trip at Cleat's Shore.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: War Weapons Week is to be marked in Walmington-on-Sea by a parade of all auxiliary services, including air-raid wardens, fire brigade, nurses, the rescue squad and of course, the Home Guard. Mainwaring decides the platoon needs a mascot for the event and plumps for a ram, but catching a suitable candidate for the job proves easier said than done. Comedy first broadcast in 1970, starring Arthur Lowe, Clive Dunn and John Le Mesurier.(n)

programme.title: All Families Have Secrets - Patrick Gale's Art of Fiction
programme.desc: Stephen Fry interviews Patrick Gale, the best-selling novelist who first caught his attention 30 years ago, as a rare example of an out gay writer willing to explore the homosexual experience in his work. Here, Fry meets Gale to discuss some of his most popular novels, including Notes from an Exhibition, and Man in an Orange Shirt, a two-part drama telling two parallel love stories set 60 years apart. Gale reveals how he often mines his own family history for inspiration, and details how this new project continues that theme, unveiling a long-held secret about his parents' marriage.(n)

programme.title: Queer as Art
programme.desc: The BBC continues to mark the 50th anniversary of decriminalisation of male homosexuality in the UK with its Gay Britannia season. This time, the focus falls on the LGBT contribution to the arts scene in the past half-decade, as Stephen Fry, David Hockney, Anthony Sher, Alan Cumming, Will Young and Alan Hollinghurst share their perspectives on the distinctive voices the community has brought to British cultural life. Also includes contributions by Val McDermid, Wayne Sleep, Julie Goodyear, Sandi Toksvig, Russell T Davies and many more.(n)

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Panellists Julia Zemiro, Matt Lucas and David Mitchell and Alan Davies compete, as Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the comedy quiz show. In this edition, the host meditates on matters medieval and macabre, and as usual, he poses questions that are so difficult, points are awarded for the answers he finds most interesting.(n)

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Fenton Bailey and Randy Barbato present an uncompromising portrait of controversial American photographer Robert Mapplethorpe. Based in New York, Mapplethorpe continually challenged the limits of acceptability via large-scale, highly stylised portraits of typically taboo subjects. His tendency to flirt with obscenity dominated his work until his death in 1989, and as the images he produced gained notoriety, he was posthumously denounced by conservative US senator Jesse Helms, who urged Congressmen to `look at the pictures' he had produced in his lifetime and decide for themselves whether they were suitable for public consumption. Here, Bailey and Barbato explain how Mapplethorpe's artistic flair was not only fuelled by what is now considered to be his genius eye, but also by his insatiable desire for celebrity.(n)

programme.title: Sleep Tight
programme.desc: The concierge of an apartment block develops an obsession with a resident, bombarding her with sinister anonymous messages and sneaking into her flat at night. The threat of discovery forces him to take far more drastic measures to satisfy his disturbing fixation. Horror, starring Luis Tosar and Marta Etura. In Spanish.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letters X, Y and Z, concluding her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.(n)

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Presenter Helen Skelton and expert garden designer Danny Clarke bring unloved gardens back to life in a single day using clever design, imaginative ideas and recycling or re-use of existing plants and materials.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes steps to ensure that fruits and vegetables give maximum cropping by dispensing advice on the summer pruning of fruit trees as well as revealing how to get the best from tomatoes and chillies. He also recommends plants that will carry on flowering into the autumn. Carol Klein meets writer Roy Lancaster as he reminisces on his life. Roy is a former Gardeners' World presenter, and with the programme's half-centenary in mind Rachel de Thame reflects on how people used to garden 50 years ago. Plus, Joe Swift and Flo Headlam help a community create a garden in Wiltshire. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: The Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: The team visits the Orkney Isles, famous for its extremes of light and dark, with constant winds and little or no frost. One would assume that little would grow in these conditions, but Jim McColl, Carole Baxter and George Anderson find that is far from the case as they meet determined local gardeners, and find how much they have achieved. As a result, there is a thriving Orkney Garden Festival across the islands. The presenters visit a host of good gardens right on the edge of Scotland on South Ronaldsay, and also host a question-and-answer session in Kirkwall.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven visits a conservation project for great bustards in Salisbury Plain, while Anita Rani meets contestants in the international young beekeepers' competition at Marlborough college and helps out with volunteers trying to stop one of England's most important chalk streams from dying up. Plus, artisanal flower growing in the Marlborough Downs and a farmer who keeps sheep for their milk.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater: Eating Together
programme.desc: Nigel focuses on dishes that bring people together, heading to Trowbridge in Wiltshire to discover what draws Moroccan families around a traditional lamb tagine. He also gets a lesson in the art of pairing spices for an Indonesian fish dish and meets Zoe, who shows him how to make Ghanaian jollof rice. Inspired by their recipes, Nigel creates a Sunday roast of pork belly and shredded duck with spiced flatbread.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Half of British families struggle to share a meal more than three times a week and yet people relish the sense of togetherness it gives them. Richard Corrigan joins Michel Roux Jr in the kitchen to prepare a hearty chicken and crayfish pie ideal for a gathering, while drinks expert Kate Goodman comes up with ales to suit the occasion and chef Andy Bates joins the team for a debate about the future of family dining.(n)

programme.title: Miss Potter
programme.desc: Victorian writer and illustrator Beatrix Potter is unable to find a firm willing to give her book based on a character called Peter Rabbit a chance, until a timid publisher with whom she falls in love takes on her project. Biographical period drama, starring Renee Zellweger, Ewan McGregor, Emily Watson and Barbara Flynn.(n)

programme.title: Live Challenge Cup Rugby League
programme.sub-title: Wigan Warriors v Salford Red Devils.
programme.desc: Wigan Warriors v Salford Red Devils (Kick-off 2.30pm). Tanya Arnold presents coverage of the second semi-final, which takes place at Halliwell Jones Stadium in Warrington. The Warriors are the most successful club in the history of this competition, having won it on 20 occasions, most recently in 2013, and appearing in 32 finals in total. In contrast, Salford have just one Challenge Cup title to their name, and that was back in 1938, and they are now bidding to progress to the showpiece match for the first time since 1969.(n)

programme.title: Live Swimming: World Championships
programme.desc: Helen Skelton presents coverage of the eighth and final day from Danube Arena in Budapest, Hungary, which will include the finals of the men's and women's 400m individual medley, as well as the men's 4x100m individual medley relay. With expert analysis from Rebecca Adlington and Mark Foster.(n)

programme.title: World War One Remembered: Passchendaele
programme.desc: Kirsty Young introduces live coverage from Flanders, Belgium, of the ceremony commemorating the 100th anniversary of the First World War battle. This is followed by a dramatic event staged in Ypres that tells the story of the battle and those involved in it, as well as performances from Alfie Boe, War Horse and the cast of The Wipers' Times. Dan Snow reports from the streets of Ypres.(n)

programme.title: Pride
programme.desc: Gay rights activists gather in London for a pride march in 1984, and decide they have a common cause with the miners' strike. When their fundraising activities are rejected by the miners' union, they travel to a Welsh pit village to show their support in person. Fact-based drama, starring Ben Schnetzer, Bill Nighy, Andrew Scott and Imelda Staunton.(n)

programme.title: Lilting
programme.desc: A man in mourning feels a need to see his dead boyfriend's mother, a Chinese woman who speaks no English and did not approve of their relationship. With the aid of an interpreter, the pair gradually form a connection as they come to terms with their grief. Drama, starring Ben Whishaw, Pei-pei Cheng and Morven Christie.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Rockpools
programme.desc: Palaeontologist Professor Richard Fortey explores the species that live within the seaside water formations, some of which have existed for millions of years. He is joined by some of the UK's leading marine biologists at the National Marine Aquarium in Plymouth to reveal new insights into the creatures' lives.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Treasure Islands
programme.desc: Explorer and naturalist Stewart McPherson travels to all the UK's Overseas Territories. His journey begins in Bermuda, in the Atlantic, where he finds ancient castles and a bird that had been thought extinct for more than 300 years. From here he sets out to the centre of the Indian Ocean, to the British Indian Ocean Territory, to find the world's biggest land invertebrate. Half a world away, he eventually reaches Pitcairn Island, lost in the vastness of the Pacific, to meet the descendants of the mutineers from the Bounty.(n)

programme.title: I Know Who You Are
programme.desc: Eva Duran and David Vila secretly observe Juan Elias's therapy sessions, and in a flashback, Alicia reveals she knows about Ana's pregnancy. Spanish thriller, with Francesc Garrido.(n)

programme.title: I Know Who You Are
programme.desc: Alicia and Heredia urge Juan Elias not to take the amnesia test, and another flashback sheds light on the circumstances of Ana's flight. Spanish thriller, starring Francesc Garrido.(n)

programme.title: Rich Hall's Countrier Than You
programme.desc: The American comedian, writer and musician explores the early origins of country music in Nashville and Austin. He visits the rustic studios where this much-loved sound was born and discovers how this genre of music has reinvented itself with influences from bluegrass, western swing and Americana. Rich examines how the music industries differ between these two cities and how they generated their own distinct twist on the genre - such as cosmic country, redneck country and the outlaw artists of the 1970s.(n)

programme.title: Bob Harris: My Nashville
programme.desc: The presenter explores America's country music capital, and reveals why Nashville became `Music City USA'. He charts the genre's Grand Ole Opry beginnings, through to the threatening onset of rock 'n' roll, to its modern mainstream hits. He also visits the east of the city, where he discovers a rebellious flip-side to the genre, and explains why a nurturing community of songwriters is responsible for country music's enduring success. Featuring interviews with Rosanne Cash, Emmylou Harris, Duane Eddy and Dave Stewart, as well as performances by local acts.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Rockpools
programme.desc: Palaeontologist Professor Richard Fortey explores the species that live within the seaside water formations, some of which have existed for millions of years. He is joined by some of the UK's leading marine biologists at the National Marine Aquarium in Plymouth to reveal new insights into the creatures' lives.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Treasure Islands
programme.desc: Explorer and naturalist Stewart McPherson travels to all the UK's Overseas Territories. His journey begins in Bermuda, in the Atlantic, where he finds ancient castles and a bird that had been thought extinct for more than 300 years. From here he sets out to the centre of the Indian Ocean, to the British Indian Ocean Territory, to find the world's biggest land invertebrate. Half a world away, he eventually reaches Pitcairn Island, lost in the vastness of the Pacific, to meet the descendants of the mutineers from the Bounty.(n)

programme.title: Secret Knowledge
programme.sub-title: Nina Simone & Me with Laura Mvula.
programme.desc: The soul singer travels to New York City to explore the songs made famous by Simone that mean the most to her, and trace the late singer's musical roots with the help of those who knew the `High Priestess of Soul'. Laura reveals the influence of Nina's classical training, meets Simone's long-time guitarist Al Shackman and performs with a Harlem gospel choir as she pays tribute to the genius of her musical heroine.(n)

programme.title: BBC Proms 2017
programme.desc: Kirsty Wark introduces a performance by the BBC National Orchestra and Chorus of Wales and the CBSO Chorus, conducted by Xian Zhang. They play Beethoven's Ninth Symphony and the European premiere of James Macmillan's A European Requiem.(n)

programme.title: BBC Proms 2017
programme.desc: A performance of Fidelio, Beethoven's only opera, with singers including Stuart Skelton accompanied by the BBC Philharmonic and choir Orfeon Donostiarra, conducted by Juanjo Mena.(n)

programme.title: Norman Wisdom: His Story
programme.desc: The life and career of the comedy actor, told by those who knew him well, from his son, daughter and daughter-in-law to famous friends including Stephen Frears, Ricky Tomlinson, Leslie Phillips, Honor Blackman and Vera Lynn.(n)

programme.title: Live AFL
programme.desc: North Melbourne and Melbourne lock horns in round 19 of the Australian Football League at the Blundstone Arena. The hosts, winless in seven, have not lost to Melbourne since 2006.(n)

programme.title: Live AFL
programme.sub-title: Live AFL: Port Adelaide v St Kilda.
programme.desc: Port Adelaide and St Kilda clash in round 19 of the Australian Football League. Port Adelaide are the best defensive team in the competition, conceding only 77 points per game.(n)

programme.title: Formula E: Street Racers
programme.desc: After 10 rounds of racing, the end to the Formula E season is now in sight. Street Racers heads to Montreal, the venue for the finale, as Sebastien Buemi aims to reclaim his title.(n)

programme.title: Singha Premiership Rugby 7s
programme.desc: Day one of the Singha Premiership Rugby 7s at Franklin's Gardens, the curtain-raiser for the new season. All 12 top-flight teams feature across two action-packed days.(n)

programme.title: Premier League World
programme.desc: This week's show comes from Hong Kong as Liverpool, Crystal Palace, West Brom and Leicester took part in the Asia Trophy. Featuring interviews with managers and key players.(n)

Because of the sophisticated nature of the bomb, suspicion falls on the members of the ordnance disposal unit Ross was part of in Iraq, but further enquiries reveal that they are being targeted as well.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A Navy officer dies following a confrontation involving a dancer and a Sudanese emigre at a strip club. programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A taxi driver recently released from prison is murdered just hours after sending an e-mail to an old alias that Callen used when he went undercover to investigate three marines who stole $5million. programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen, Sam and the team spring into action when fellow agent Dom activates a distress signal.
