programme.title: MASH
programme.desc: Irreverent black comedy following the exploits of a host of offbeat characters at a medical unit during the Korean war, including surgeons Hawkeye Pierce and Trapper John McIntyre who create havoc with their martini parties and practical jokes while the war rages around them. The film spawned a successful television series and won an Oscar for best screenplay, written by Ring Lardner Jr(n)

programme.title: Born on the Fourth of July
programme.desc: The second of three films by co-writer/director Oliver Stone to explore the effects of the Vietnam War (Platoon and Heaven and Earth are the others), Born On The Fourth Of July tells the true story of Ron Kovic (Tom Cruise), a patriotic, All-American small town athlete who shocks his family by enlisting with the Marines to fight in the Vietnam War. Once he is overseas, however, Kovic's gung-ho enthusiasm turns to horror and confusion when he accidentally kills one of his own men in a firefight. His downfall is furthered by a bullet wound that leaves him paralyzed from the chest down. He returns home, spends an appalling, nightmarish stint in a veterans' hospital, and follows an increasingly disillusioned and fragmented path that ultimately leaves him drunk and dissolute in Mexico. However, Kovic somehow turns himself around and pulls his life together, becoming an outspoken anti-war activist in the process. The film is long but emotionally powerful; many consider it Stone's best work and Cruise's best performance. Both were nominated for Oscars, as was the film itself, but only Stone, who co-wrote the film with Kovic from the latter's book, won for Best Director(n)

programme.title: Pearl Harbor
programme.desc: News of the death of air ace Rafe reaches his sweetheart, who starts to fall for his best pal. Rafe shows up alive in Hawaii, but the trio's problems look miniscule in comparison to the devastation wreaked by the Japanese on Pearl Harbor. Romance set against a blockbuster backdrop with the biggest budget ever footed by a single studio. Explosive(n)

programme.title: Hacksaw Ridge
programme.desc: Mel Gibson directed this biopic about World War II Army medic Desmond Doss (played here by Andrew Garfield). A conscientious objector who refused to take a life or even carry a weapon, Doss was eventually awarded the Medal of Honor for saving the lives of 75 soldiers on the battlefields of Okinawa. Hugo Weaving, Teresa Palmer, Vince Vaughn, and Sam Worthington co-star in Gibson's return to the director's seat(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: Docudrama about two young arms dealers who win a $300 million contract to supply weaponry to US forces in Afghanistan(n)

programme.title: Platoon
programme.desc: This drama examines the fight between good and evil among an American infantry platoon in the jungles of Vietnam(n)

programme.title: The Deer Hunter

programme.title: Grey Gardens

The mother and daughter, relations of Jackie Onassis, were prominent figures on the New York social scene, before their lives took a very different turn. Retreating to their summer home, Grey Gardens, the women became eccentric recluses, until film-makers Albert and David Maysles visit the crumbling mansion to capture their fascinating story on film(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Comfortably Chum. El representante de una de las grandes concesionarias de autos de la región llega a la tienda. ¿El motivo? Está interesado en el Dodge 1924 que los chicos guardan en su garage. ¿Se animarán a venderlo o Rick no logrará cerrar un acuerdo? Luego, finalizada esa negociación, analizan si comprar algunos uniformes de un general del ejército soviético, y Chumlee tiene problemas en su casa. ¿Encontrará un nuevo lugar para dormir?(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Silent Stars and Rebel Cars. Acelérese mientras Corey examina un Buick de 1940 que supuestamente perteneció a Fidel Castro. ¿Tratará de aprovechar la oportunidad para comprar el sedán del camarada? Después, Rick se queda mudo cuando aparece en la tienda la licencia de conducir de Charlie Chaplin. ¿Acaso esta pieza rara de la historia cinematográfica les representará una suma importante? Y más adelante: Chum se interesa repentinamente por el mundo de las inversiones y comienza a colocar su dinero en lo que hace. La pregunta es si terminará con más dinero o más problemas(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: I'll Be Doggone. La tienda da el gran salto cuando Rick examina una mochila cohete del programa espacial Gemini, utilizada para demostrar que estos artefactos podrían funcionar en entornos de gravedad cero. ¿Les hará Rick una oferta estelar? Después, Chumlee se vuelve loco con un libro de muñequitosde Snoopy que tiene un dibujo personal de Charles Schulz. ¿Podrá Chumlee acertar al darle al balón y cerrar el trato? Y más adelante: la idea de Rick de un comercial para la tienda inspira a Chumlee a crear su propia versión. ¿Cuál de los dos comerciales ganará?(n)

programme.title: Quest for the Lost Ark
programme.desc: The Ark of the Covenant, the sacred container housing the stone tablets on which Moses inscribed the Ten Commandments, has inspired intrepid quests since it disappeared over 2,500 years ago. Hollywood's Indiana Jones grappled with Nazis to capture the Ark, which is believed to possess incredible destructive powers. And for the last 20 years a real-life adventurer, Professor Tudor Parfitt, has been searching for the last resting place of the Ark. Inspired by ancient documents and codes in Oxford and Jerusalem, the quest has taken Parfitt, a Professor of Modern Jewish Studies at London's prestigious School of Oriental and African Studies, on an incredible journey across the Middle East, Arabia and Africa. And now, controversially, he believes he can finally answer the riddle of the Ark and reveal its location. But the Professor is overwhelmed when he finally comes face-to-face with the ancient artefact that he believes to be the Ark, in the last place he expects to find it and looked after by people who have no idea of the significance of their possession. His theory is built upon incredible DNA research that reveals a lost tribe of Israel, and his research asks major question about what the Ark really was(n)

programme.desc: The world's best assassins converge upon the streets of a small Scottish town to compete in a deadly tournament in which the last killer standing gets a million-dollar prize while wealthy thrillseekers watch a live video stream and gamble on the outcome. programme.title: Kick-Ass
programme.desc: Adapted from Mark Millar's hyper-violent comic book of the same name, director Matthew Vaughn's (Layer Cake) vigilante superhero film tells the tale of an average New York teenager who decides to don a costume and fight crime. Comic book geek Dave Lizewski (Aaron Johnson) may not have good coordination or special powers, but that doesn't mean he isn't a fully capable crime fighter. After purchasing a flashy wet suit on the Internet, Dave starts busting up baddies with nothing but brute force. He calls himself Kick-Ass, and he can take a beating as good as he can dish one out. Before long, Kick-Ass has become a local sensation, and others are following his lead. Big Daddy (Nicolas Cage) and Hit-Girl (Chloe Moretz) are a father-daughter crime-fighting duo who have set their sights on local mob heavy Frank D'Amico (Mark Strong). They're doing a decent job of dismantling Frank's sizable underworld empire when Kick-Ass gets drawn into the fray. But Frank's men play rough, and his son, Chris (Christopher Mintz-Plasse), is about to become Kick-Ass' very first arch nemesis. When Chris assumes the persona of Red Mist, the stage is set for a superhero showdown that could spell the end of Kick-Ass once and for all(n)

programme.title: A View to a Kill
programme.desc: James Bond clashes with a megalomaniac international businessman plotting a global takeover of the computer industry by engineering a devastating earthquake in California's Silicon Valley - and killing millions in the process. Spy adventure, starring Roger Moore in his final appearance as 007 alongside Christopher Walken, Grace Jones, Tanya Roberts and Patrick Macnee.(n)

programme.title: Diana, Our Mother: Her Life and Legacy
programme.desc: The Duke of Cambridge and Prince Harry talk about their mother Diana, Princess of Wales, and pay tribute to the many ways her influence has shaped their lives. The brothers share some of their earliest memories of her, recall the final contact they had with her before her death in August 1997 and discuss their feelings in the aftermath of that event. Featuring contributions from Elton John, Rihanna and Diana's brother, Earl Spencer.(n)

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
programme.desc: The young wizard struggles to convince his fellow sorcerers that the evil Lord Voldemort has returned to life. When Hogwarts headmaster Dumbledore is ousted in favour of a sadistic replacement, Harry realises he must take matters into his own hands, uniting his fellow pupils to form a secret army and training them for the inevitable confrontation to come. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson, Rupert Grint, Gary Oldman, Michael Gambon and Alan Rickman.(n)

programme.title: Judge Rinder's Crime Stories
programme.desc: Barrister Robert Rinder explores a 1986 murder that had notable similarities to a crime from three years earlier. The creator of DNA fingerprinting helped the police with his recently developed techniques, allowing them to identify the killer before he could strike again. Plus, an incident involving two runners and a courier carrying a deadly package.(n)

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: Recruitment manager Neale from Northampton, fire training officer Will from London, banker Johnny from Glasgow, and holiday-camp entertainer Ben from Essex all enter Paddy McGuinness's `love lift'. Stepping out in front of a panel of 30 single women, each man must try to get as many of the ladies as possible to keep their podium lights on to signal their approval.(n)

programme.title: The Hot Desk
programme.desc: The Voice host receives a grilling in an exclusive interview over the Hot Desk.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Omnibus. Rhona is anxious about going to court and asks Paddy to support her. However, a revelation about a piece of key evidence leaves her with fresh hope that justice will be done. Megan is on edge when Charity sees her with Frank, while Priya gets caught by Leyla taking a pregnancy test.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Omnibus. Toyah and Peter settle in as the new Rovers owners, and Leanne calls in with Simon and Oliver as they have nowhere to live now that Nick has sold the flat and the new tenants are moving in. Meanwhile, Gemma thinks Chesney should sue the bistro after Michelle gives him £200 in a card.(n)

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: A line-dancing instructor from Cheshire, a Warwickshire professional footballer, an Essex student and a motorsport events manager from Kent enter the love lift in the hope of impressing 30 single women. All four hopefuls will be turning on the charm in a bid to land a date on the Isle of Fernandos. However, to have any chance of succeeding, they must ensure the female participants keep their lights on as a sign of approval. Plus, last week's couples go on their dates, discovering whether they are a match made in heaven or hell. Paddy McGuinness presents.(n)

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: New series. Stephen Mulhern returns with the guessing game-show in which three contestants are challenged to figure out which familiar lie behind a series of animated clues. For this opening episode, Stephen is joined by a trio of celebrity contestants; Diversity's Ashley Banjo, Benidorm actor Jake Canuso and TV presenter Lorraine Kelly, who all stay in the game right through to the Super Catchphrase round.(n)

programme.title: Harry Hill's Alien Fun Capsule
programme.desc: Madcap panel show presented by the comedian, who presides over two teams nominally tasked with saving the planet from any potential alien invasion. The first episode features panellists Kelvin Fletcher, Sara Pascoe, Patrick Robinson and Josh Widdicombe, who must find clips, people and anything that is fun or funny enough for Harry to place in the capsule which, in the event that the planet is invaded by aliens, can be presented to them to demonstrate earthlings are good fun and therefore worthy of saving.(n)

programme.title: You've Been Framed
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers, featuring everything from giddy grandmas, cute kids and crazy animals to below-the-belt mishaps, practical jokers and painful-looking accidents.(n)

programme.title: See Spot Run
programme.desc: An FBI drug-sniffing dog's remarkable abilities earn the wrath of a ruthless Mob boss, who puts a price on its head. The crimebusting pooch is sent into hiding, but escapes and is adopted by a bungling postman, who is soon running for his life from hitmen pursuing his four-legged friend. Comedy, starring David Arquette, Michael Clarke Duncan, Leslie Bibb and Paul Sorvino.(n)

programme.title: The Smurfs 2
programme.desc: The tiny blue forest-dwelling creatures and their human friends go on a rescue mission to Paris. Their old foe Gargamel the evil wizard has created mischievous smurfs of his own and kidnapped Smurfette to learn the secret of her magic. Fantasy comedy sequel, starring Hank Azaria and Neil Patrick Harris, with the voices of Katy Perry and Christina Ricci. Includes Lotto.(n)

programme.title: Evan Almighty
programme.desc: Politician Evan Baxter is recruited by God for a special mission. A great flood is coming, and like Noah before him, Evan has to build an ark to protect the wildlife of the world from the impending cataclysm. However, convincing others that the end is nigh proves difficult. Comedy sequel to Bruce Almighty, starring Steve Carell, John Goodman, Lauren Graham and Morgan Freeman.(n)

programme.title: The Hangover
programme.desc: Three men on a stag weekend in Las Vegas wake up after a night of heavy drinking and find they have not only misplaced the groom, but somehow gained a tiger and a baby. Unable to remember the details of the night before, they set about piecing the clues together in the hope of finding their missing friend. Comedy, starring Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms and Zach Galifianakis.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter and Lois try to steer Chris away from joining the army by getting him interested in other activities - but Stewie remains determined to enlist, eager to get his hands on some heavy-duty firepower. With the guest voice of Louis Gossett Jr.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Part three of three. Stewie discovers what his life is like in the future, and decides to go back in time to change events. Animated comedy, with the voices of Seth MacFarlane, Alex Borstein and Seth Green.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Stewie's favourite teddy bear is ruined by a dog, and he grows attached to Lois after she tries to repair it. Meanwhile, Peter visits the doctor for a flu vaccination, but goes into a state of shock when given a prostate examination.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger forms an elaborate plan involving swapping identities to help Steve get a date with a girl at his school, while Stan and Francine become air stewardesses to thwart an evil plot to blow up the sun by guest star Mark Cuban.(n)

programme.title: Keith Lemon: The Film
programme.desc: A would-be entrepreneur from Leeds travels to London, where he hopes to make a name for himself as an inventor. After a series of disastrous failures, his fortunes begin to turn around, but fame goes to his head and he starts to turn his back on his Northern roots. Comedy, starring Leigh Francis, Laura Aikman, Verne Troyer and Kevin Bishop.(n)

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK.(n)

programme.title: You've Been Framed
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates another selection of camcorder calamities, featuring sports day disasters, bowling mishaps and birthday nightmares. Funny dogs also feature, and the comedian showcases viewers' mobile clips in You've Been Phoned.(n)

programme.title: The Waterboy
programme.desc: An American football team's waterboy puts up with constant ridicule from the players. But one day his anger gets the better of him and he demonstrates an unexpected talent for tackling - so the coach gives him a chance to prove his worth on the pitch. However, he has to keep his blossoming sporting career a secret from his overprotective mother. Comedy, with Adam Sandler, Kathy Bates, Henry Winkler and Fairuza Balk.(n)

programme.title: Yogi Bear
programme.desc: A conniving bear and his diminutive sidekick learn that the national park they live in is due to be closed down by the greedy local mayor. They must join forces with their old foe, a park ranger who resents their mischief-making, to save the day. Comedy based on the cartoon series, starring Anna Faris and Tom Cavanagh, and featuring the voices of Dan Aykroyd and Justin Timberlake.(n)

programme.title: Nanny McPhee
programme.desc: A Victorian widower struggles to control his seven unruly children, who have already driven a series of childminders to distraction. But a strange-looking nanny with a few tricks up her sleeve soon gets the youngsters into line, leaving their weary father to concentrate on finding a new wife. Period fantasy adventure, starring Emma Thompson, Colin Firth and Kelly Macdonald.(n)

programme.title: Step Up
programme.desc: An aspiring ballerina finds her life turned upside down when she encounters a troubled street-smart teenager from the wrong side of town. But as the pair get together to work on a dance project, they develop a mutual admiration, and love begins to blossom between them. Romantic drama, starring Channing Tatum and Jenna Dewan.(n)

programme.desc: Caroline Flack reunites this year's contestants and finds out how things have changed since they left the villa.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter turns whistleblower when Carter buys the Pawtucket Brewery and decides to cut corners to save money, while Brian enlists Stewie to help him get his driving licence back.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter's performance at work suffers after he injures his hand in a fireworks accident, so Lois volunteers to help him out. Meanwhile, Brian tells Stewie he is dating someone, but the baby ridicules him when he discovers it is an attractive but unintelligent woman. Featuring the voice of Drew Barrymore.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg tries to build up her savings by starting work at a huge new superstore, but it proves so popular that all the other local shops go out of business, prompting Brian and Stewie to lead a protest against the retail giant.(n)

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan and Jack are initially peeved at being made to wear new, up-to-date uniforms - until they are spotted by two gullible Swedish women who mistake them for dashing airline pilots.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Not for the first time, Jessica delves behind the scenes of the film industry, this time to investigate a stuntman's death in what should have been a routine car crash. Whodunit, starring Angela Lansbury.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica visits a New York auction to buy a valuable manuscript and uncovers foul play among her rival bidders. Whodunit, starring Angela Lansbury as a crime writer with a mystery-solving sideline.(n)

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: The Happiest Days of Your Life - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Primrose falls for a roofing contractor, while the twins prove too much of a handful for their school, prompting a trip to view the facilities on offer at Brockhurst College. Nostalgic comedy drama, starring David Jason and Pam Ferris.(n)

programme.title: Death Becomes Her
programme.desc: Two romantic rivals are both granted the secret of eternal youth by a mysterious mystic. However, as they battle to get their claws into a plastic surgeon, they discover their now-immortal bodies are capable of taking whatever damage they can dish out. Black comedy fantasy, starring Goldie Hawn, Meryl Streep, Bruce Willis and Isabella Rossellini.(n)

programme.title: Death Becomes Her
programme.desc: Two romantic rivals are both granted the secret of eternal youth by a mysterious mystic. However, as they battle to get their claws into a plastic surgeon, they discover their now-immortal bodies are capable of taking whatever damage they can dish out. Black comedy fantasy, starring Goldie Hawn, Meryl Streep, Bruce Willis and Isabella Rossellini.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Agenda for Murder
programme.desc: A crooked lawyer hopes to start a promising political career, but a former client he saved from prison threatens to blow the whistle on him. The attorney murders the blackmailer and makes it look like suicide - but the shabby sleuth sees through his ruse and sets out to expose the truth. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Louis Zorich and Patrick McGoohan, who also directed.(n)

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: A climber plunges to his death from a cliff face and a police informant claims it was no accident. A re-enactment of the incident adds fuel to the fire, and Wycliffe braces himself to interview the dead man's best friend. Drama, starring Jack Shepherd, Helen Masters, Lynn Farleigh, Christian Solimeno and Paul Venables.(n)

programme.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The super-sleuth visits a village to investigate a number of mysterious deaths, and tries to prove they have a logical rather than a supernatural explanation. Feature-length drama, starring Jeremy Brett, with Roy Marsden and Keith Barron.(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Hathaway and Lewis struggle to determine whether a death during a college-based clinical trial for a new antidepressant was murder or suicide, and receive little assistance from the institution's evasive psychiatric professor. A second student's demise then leads to the revelation that the trial's participants are all operating under the influence of a mind-altering drug, and that the lines between love, obsession and madness have become dangerously blurred. Guest starring Douglas Henshall (Primeval), Lucy Liemann (Rev) and Thomas Brodie Sangster (Love Actually).(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.sub-title: A Pocket Full of Rye - Parts One & Two.
programme.desc: When a business magnate, his wife and their maid are murdered, Miss Marple (Julia McKenzie) is prompted by the circumstances surrounding the incidents to recall the nursery rhyme Sing a Song of Sixpence. She discovers the victims were part of a family tainted by secrets, and as she ponders the significance of the tune, a past scandal reveals itself. Murder mystery, featuring Wendy Richard as feisty cook Mrs Crump, in her final dramatic role. Other guest stars include Prunella Scales, Matthew Macfadyen, Ralf Little, Rupert Graves and Helen Baxendale.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: The detective's god-daughter Lydia and her son James - who is severely traumatised by a bombing at his school - come to stay unexpectedly. Struggling to look after the lad when his mother goes missing, Foyle's life suffers a further complication when the body of a local man is found near a military centre - leading him into the top-secret world of weapons research. Kate Fleetwood and Michael Jayston guest star, with Michael Kitchen and Honeysuckle Weeks.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A tragic communication error between officers leaves gay police constable Nick Bentley caught in the crossfire of armed drug dealers, with no back-up. Brooks and Devlin follow a lead to a small-time dealer who claims to have seen a second policeman standing nearby, doing nothing while his partner bled to death. The story shocks the detectives and their boss Chandler as they investigate a homophobic religious group at the centre of the incident involving members of their own force. Crime drama, starring Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Harriet Walter.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks and Devlin investigate when the body of missing 10-year-old Jodie Gaines is found in a skip. The pair immediately identify two main suspects - a taxi driver who claims to have dropped the girl off at her guitar lesson, and the teacher who swears she never arrived. The case then takes an unexpected turn, leaving Steel and Phillips with the toughest choices of their careers. Dervla Kirwan guest stars, alongside Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Freema Agyeman.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks, Devlin and Chandler investigate after a man is found badly beaten in a park. They discover the victim, Roland Kirk - who lives in a nearby camper van - had many enemies in the community, but nobody is willing to talk. The case then takes a decisive turn when a local man capitulates after being arrested and points the finger at architect Harry Morgan, whose son had recently turned against him and aligned himself with Kirk. Kevin McNally guest stars, with Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Harriet Walter.(n)

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan begins courting Blakey's demure, well-to-do niece, who tries to smarten him up - but it only takes one meeting with his family to make her realise he is a hopeless case. Reg Varney and Stephen Lewis star.(n)

programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

Black comedy fantasy, starring Goldie Hawn, Meryl Streep, Bruce Willis and Isabella Rossellini.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An elderly man reports an unusual break-in, during which the uninvited visitor left a mysterious statue on the kitchen table. It soon emerges that it is just the first in a series of unexplained events, as a police phone box arrives and then disappears from his garden, cement is delivered to his house for no apparent reason and a fire is started in his garage. Noakes advises Steve to keep well away as it is not technically a police matter, but the officer decides to investigate further. Rural drama, starring Trevor Ray, Georgie Glen and James Carlton.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Vernon buys a batch of topsoil for his new compost-producing business, little suspecting it is from a contaminated landfill site. The shady dealer who sold him the soil winds up dead - as do a number of local cows - and Vernon is soon fighting for his life. Elsewhere, seductive sergeant Nokes sets her sights on Steve Crane, and Bellamy wonders whether Gina will return to Aidensfield and marry him. Geoffrey Hughes, James Carlton and Mark Jordon star.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica comes to the rescue of her friend, a beauty salon owner suspected of murdering a rival who was planning to poach one of her best hairdressers. Whodunit, starring Angela Lansbury.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica is called to testify in a court case concerning a crooked investment firm, but the key witness dies shortly afterwards. Angela Lansbury stars as the sleuth, with Lisa Eichhorn and Larry Linville.(n)

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: The Happiest Days of Your Life - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. The twins abscond from Brockhurst College, but Pop manages to bring them back safe and sound - then lends his services to ensure the boarding school does not have to close. Meanwhile, Primrose makes an unusual request concerning affairs of the heart and Charley launches a bid to buy a local brewery. David Jason stars.(n)

programme.title: Rest in Peace, Mrs Columbo
programme.desc: The wife of a criminal who died in prison swears revenge on the men she holds responsible for his incarceration - including Columbo. She kills one of her targets, and the shabby sleuth is assigned to the case. As she faces his well-honed approach to sniffing out a suspect, she plots to murder his wife. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Helen Shaver and Ian McShane.(n)

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: A policeman's murder gives Wycliffe plenty to think about - especially as the chief suspect is a fellow officer who has been having an affair with the victim's wife. Adding to the pressure, senior figures within the force want the matter cleared up as quickly as possible to avoid a scandal. Jack Shepherd and Helen Masters star.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: The detective's god-daughter Lydia and her son James - who is severely traumatised by a bombing at his school - come to stay unexpectedly. Struggling to look after the lad when his mother goes missing, Foyle's life suffers a further complication when the body of a local man is found near a military centre - leading him into the top-secret world of weapons research. Kate Fleetwood and Michael Jayston guest star, with Michael Kitchen and Honeysuckle Weeks.(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A student production of The Merchant of Venice is halted when the actor playing Shylock is murdered during the performance. Lewis and Hathaway are struck by the lack of grief among the cast and crew - especially the ambitious director, who wastes no time recasting the role. The detectives discover the victim had an expensive lifestyle and not only owed money to his fellow students, but was also suspected of stealing from them. However, the investigation has barely got under way before the killer strikes again. Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox star.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a family glassware business collapses following the death of one of its partners, Barnaby investigates allegations of financial irregularities, love triangles and a string of murders. Lapsed Freemason Jones uses his inside knowledge to explore the ceremonial aspects of two killings, but it is Cully's production of Hamlet that gives Tom the key to the mystery. John Nettles, Jason Hughes, Jane Wymark and Laura Howard star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks and Devlin are called to investigate when a man is attacked and his kidney is surgically removed. The focus quickly turns to finding the intended recipient of the organ, and the team is horrified to discover that it has been trafficked into the NHS and given to wealthy patient Joanna Woodleigh. When the case is handed over to the CPS, a conflict of interests becomes apparent as Steel and Phillips go up against George Castle in court. Denis Lawson guest stars, with Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Freema Agyeman.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks and Devlin investigate the death of middle-class teenager Debbie Powell. They discover the victim had been living a secret life as a drugs mule, and was being led astray by local dealer Gerry Craig. The case has an emotional impact on Castle, who demands Steel and Phillips do everything in their power to bring the person responsible to justice. Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Bill Paterson star.(n)

programme.title: Goals of the 90s
programme.desc: A selection of memorable goals scored in the 1990s.(n)

programme.title: Tommy Cooper
programme.desc: The incomparable comedian performs a variety of sketches and magic tricks, joined by husky-voiced actress Joan Greenwood.(n)

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: Simon Templar encounters a deadly lady with a gun and an attitude - and soon finds himself caught in the middle of an all-out revolution. Starring Roger Moore.(n)

programme.title: The Darts Show
programme.desc: Hannah East visits Shanghai and Las Vegas to report on all the action as the second and third events of the World Series of Darts Tour.(n)

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents racing from Croft, featuring action from round 12 of the Ginetta Juniors and round 10 of the Renault Clio Cup UK.(n)

programme.title: Road Racing Series
programme.desc: The Southern 100. Further highlights from the event staged on the Isle of Man, which featured races in various categories starting and finishing at Castletown.(n)

programme.title: The Classic Car Show
programme.desc: Quentin Willson celebrates the Ferrari Testarossa and Jodie Kidd is taken for a spin in a Mercedes 190 SL by fellow model David Gandy. Chris Routledge salvages an Owen Sedanca - one of the world's rarest cars - while Alex Riley meets a family addicted to Austin A30s and Bruno Senna puts a Ferrari 308 through its paces on the test track.(n)

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: A ministerial secretary innocently leaks information regarding a secret peace talks meeting to her lover, leading to a shooting incident and placing the future of the summit in jeopardy. While her boyfriend's involvement remains in doubt, Cowley gets her to pass on false information in the hope it will prove his innocence or confirm his guilt. Drama, starring Gordon Jackson, Lewis Collins and Martin Shaw.(n)

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: CI5 is faced with a terrifying campaign of explosions and assassinations, apparently committed by an opposing operative that Cowley is convinced he killed several years earlier. It appears that he is either mistaken or an old associate of his former adversary is seeking revenge. Gordon Jackson stars.(n)

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur is conned into buying a dodgy greyhound and lumbered with a pile of knocked-off videos, and it is up to Terry to save him from a fate worse than death. Vintage drama, starring Dennis Waterman, George Cole and Patrick Malahide.(n)

programme.title: Minder
programme.sub-title: Give Us This Day Arthur Daley's Bread.
programme.desc: Arthur employs a truck-load of ex-cons as cheap labour for his new landscape gardening business and things go swimmingly - until a series of thefts puts paid to the enterprise and he finds himself out of pocket. Vintage comedy drama, starring George Cole.(n)

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: Soldiers are separated from their comrades-in-arms during the Dunkirk evacuation and face a terrifying journey to safety. A heroic lance corporal takes charge, aiming to lead the platoon to sanctuary while those around him panic. Second World War adventure, starring John Mills, Richard Attenborough, Robert Urquhart and Bernard Lee.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Christine doesn't do herself any favours in the popularity stakes, telling Louise she might not have a job to come back to once she has had the baby, and accusing Robert of taking Jack's side in a problematic case. Meanwhile, Kate gets a final warning after leaving a patient choking, and David makes plans for a party in celebration of his move into surgery. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A woman asks Kavanagh to ensure justice is done on behalf of her husband, who died on the operating table in mysterious circumstances - despite the surgeon's claims that he was alive and well when she stitched him up. As if that were not a tough enough assignment, the redoubtable barrister also faces the task of convincing son Matt that failing his A levels is not the end of the world. John Thaw stars with his real-life wife Sheila Hancock, Josette Simon, Lisa Harrow and Tom Brodie.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Things may be about to change for Nick when a new inspector arrives and Kate receives a job offer. Elsewhere, Greengrass struggles with his finances. Rural drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: When mauled sheep carcasses are found, Nick and Kate suspect there may be a beast on the moors. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A new family cause panic in Aidensfield when their rabid dog goes missing, and Nick suspects Greengrass of poaching.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: James blames Richard's interference when his offer of marriage is rejected by Hazel, but a visit from his beloved's father reveals the truth of the situation.(n)

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.sub-title: The Swords of Wayland - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Robin and the outlaws leave Sherwood to defend a distant village from a band of phantom horsemen known as the Hounds of Lucifer, who terrorise the countryside on the orders of a powerful coven ruled by Morgwyn of Ravenscar. Guest starring Rula Lenska.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A cleaner is found dead in her home and suspicion immediately falls upon her lodger, who is arrested and convicted of her murder. It appears to be an open-and-shut case, but Superintendent Spence begins to question the man's guilt and invites Poirot to help uncover the identity of the real killer. The Belgian sleuth teams up with crime writer Ariadne Oliver (My Family's Zoe Wanamaker) as he tries to crack the case. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Richard Hope, Joe Absolom, Amanda Root, Sian Phillips and Raquel Cassidy.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Schoolgirl Jennifer Sutcliffe becomes embroiled in a mystery when priceless jewels are hidden among her belongings. The precious stones once belonged to a prince who fell foul of a revolution, and now his cousin is a pupil at the same school as Jennifer, where Poirot finds himself drawn into the unlikely situation and realises nothing is quite what it seems. David Suchet stars as the Belgian sleuth, with Harriet Walter (Law & Order: UK) and Claire Skinner (Outnumbered).(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A body is discovered on the Northumberland moors, and identified as a woman who made a distressed 999 call on the night of her death - suggesting she may have been abducted by someone she knew. Vera takes on the case, and discovers the victim was a controversial figure in her home town, who had a complicated relationship with her family and a number of well-hidden secrets.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the discovery of a young man's body in an area notorious for illicit teenage gatherings, the corpse wrapped in plastic sheeting and having received a blow to the head. Vera follows the trail to a funfair where the victim used to work and a church where he sought refuge, having recently been made homeless. She delves into his family history to discover why he was on the streets when his parents lived nearby, while forensic evidence implicates the son of the vicar, who has a criminal past.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.sub-title: To Burn in Every Drop of Blood - Part One.

When the victim of a frenzied attack is found in the woods, the team initially wonders whether it is random or related to the location - a shrine to a local girl who recently committed suicide there. However, Banks has a theory of his own. Crime drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.sub-title: To Burn in Every Drop of Blood - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. When a woman commits suicide, her grieving father relies on violence to procure answers as he investigates his daughter's death. She left a note confessing to Damon Horsley's murder, but Banks is suspicious, and his hunch is confirmed when it appears that the woman's death is not a simple suicide and someone else may have been involved. The pressure is on as the team gathers evidence and tries to solve two murders. Crime drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson, Andrea Lowe, Caroline Catz and Jack Deam.(n)

Drama set in Sheffield in 1982, starring Sophie Rundle, Penelope Wilton, Angela Griffin and Sharon Rooney.(n)

programme.title: The Ruth Rendell Mysteries

Drama, starring Phoebe Nicholls, Christine Kavanagh, Julian Wadham and Sally Sanders. Last in the series.(n)

programme.desc: New clinical director Jack tries to curry favour with Christine by criticising Robert's management skills, while David's first day in surgery doesn't go as well as he'd hoped. Mike returns from London wanting his old job back, but walks straight into a fiery situation with Cathy, who's none too pleased to see him. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and David Harewood.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Christine grows closer to Jack as her professional relationship with Robert continues to deteriorate, but is under no illusions about what her boss wants from her. Mike realises there are plenty more fish in the sea and vows to have a good time playing the field, and Kate's moonlighting gets her into trouble. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: A man caught transporting illegal immigrants panics and holds staff hostage in a bid to avoid any police involvement. Jack takes control of the situation, proving there's more to him than meets the eye, while Andrew is emotionally scarred by the experience. Elsewhere, Sam and Mike make no attempt to deny they're an item when everyone finds out they're sharing a flat. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.desc: Nick goes undercover to investigate smuggling in Whitby, while Kate is the bearer of bad news for a girl seeking advice about abortions.(n)

programme.desc: Roger worries about who will make the team's teas when Mim is taken ill. Cricketing comedy drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, Robert Daws, Timothy Spall and Josie Lawrence.(n)

programme.desc: The detective's friend Sir Charles Cartwright (guest star Martin Shaw) hosts a cocktail party at his home in Cornwall, where an amiable local priest chokes to death on his drink. There seems to be no motive for murder, and no trace of poison found in the victim's glass, but weeks later, when Sir Charles's doctor friend Sir Bartholomew Strange dies in similar circumstances, he and Poirot team up to investigate. Drama, with Art Malik, Jane Asher and Anna Carteret, and David Suchet in the title role.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A guest at a village Halloween party boasts of having witnessed a murder years previously - and later meets a grisly end in keeping with the macabre spirit of the occasion. Arriving to investigate, Poirot delves back into the annals of local life - and uncovers a series of mysterious deaths, any one of which could have a bearing on the present case. David Suchet, Amelia Bullmore and Zoe Wanamaker star.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Poirot visits a garden fete where he meets the son of an old friend and his fiancee. After having tea with the couple, the sleuth suspects that they are both in danger and Hastings' new interest in photography provides him with the clue to solve a mystery involving cyanide, failing brakes and mixed-up love lives.(n)

programme.title: Victoria
programme.desc: Prince Albert arrives in England for the first time, and he and Victoria take an instant dislike to each other in an awkward first encounter. However, their disdain quickly passes and an attraction grows between them, to Melbourne's dismay. Below stairs, Albert's valet clashes with the royal servants, while Skerrett is visited by a girl in need of money.(n)

programme.title: The Americans

Jenny and Pete's money worries have taken a toll on their marriage and particularly their sex life, leading Jenny to remind him of the bedroom fantasies they used to act out when they were younger. programme.desc: The use of forensic technology in the search for some of America's 1.8 million missing persons, from runaways who find their way home to those who vanish for ever without trace.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The difficulties faced by forensic scientists and police in catching bombers and snipers, who often have no connection to their victims.(n)

programme.desc: The murder of New England handyman Jack Reid in June 2005. Two men eventually confessed to helping kill Reid, claiming millionaire John Brooks paid them to ambush him in a barn, where they said Brooks helped beat the victim to death with a hammer.(n)

programme.desc: The murder of cocktail waitress Shauna Tiaffay in September 2012. Her husband George became the prime suspect, though he had an alibi. It later transpired he had hired homeless man Noel Stevens to carry out the act.(n)

programme.desc: The case of Louisiana student Mickey Shunick, who went missing after a night out in May 2012. Police failed to make a breakthrough until they spoted her on surveillance footage. Eventually a registered sex offender pleaded guilty to killing the 21-year-old, and also being responsible for the death of another woman whose body had been found in September 1999.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of University of Florida student Christian Aguilar, who vanished from his campus in September 2012. Police were stumped until CCTV footage took the case in a shocking new direction, helping lead them to the 18-year-old's body.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of nursing student Michelle Le, whose body was found in a remote Californian canyon four months after she disappeared in May 2011. Giselle Esteban was later found guilty of murdering the 26-year-old after she became jealous of her relationship Le had with the father of her child.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of student Kenia Monge, who disappeared without a trace. The search hit dead ends until detectives uncovered chilling surveillance footage, revealing what had befallen her.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of North Dakota student Dru Sjodin, who vanished in November 2003. CCTV footage showed Dru's last movements revealing the chilling reason for her disappearance.(n)

programme.desc: The case of 24-year-old former cheerleader Amy Lord. CCTV footage from ATMs and outside her home captured the moment she was taken by her killer.(n)

programme.desc: After dropping her two boys at school in Coral Springs, Florida, Surya Toha vanishes without a trace. Chilling CCTV footage reveals exactly what happened to her.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of 19-year-old student Katie Poirier, who vanished while working the graveyard shift at a petrol station. CCTV footage revealed an answer - but left a community in fear.(n)

programme.desc: The fatal shooting of mother-of-five Barbara Weaver, in June 2009. Her husband Eli rapidly confessed that his mistress, Barbara Raber, committed the murder in the victim's bedroom. She had pulled the trigger while he had gone fishing as an alibi.(n)

programme.desc: A mother shot dead within sight of her toddler. The case sparked a murder investigation of passion, kidnapping and intimidation - and the contents of a dictaphone proved important.(n)

programme.desc: A case in which a woman called emergency services claiming a man had shot her boyfriend. Detectives had to untangle a twisted web of jealousy to find out who had performed the act.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: A recently married couple seek to mark the next chapter of their lives by buying a holiday apartment together in Fuerteventura, one of Spain's Canary Islands. Jean and Stuart Knight are planning to spend several weeks there every year both on their own and also with family and friends. Ben Hillman shows the pair five options within their budget of £60,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Tim and Irene Foster find a property on the Cape Peninsula with a budget of £240,000. Irene comes from Cape Town and dreams of seeing her family more often.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jerry and Christine Steele's love of South Africa began decades ago and they have decided to spend part of their retirement in a second home among the beaches and national parks of the Garden Route stretch of the south-eastern coast. For their budget of £60,000, Laura Hamilton shows them five great value properties.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps nurses Philip Vaux and Alec Billen from Somerset search for a holiday home in Almeria, south Spain, showing them properties from a townhouse to a country pad.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Marketing manager Clair Sherwood-Parkin hosts the first party in Darlington, Co Durham, hoping to impress with a Moroccan-inspired feast. However, one guest causes a stir when she introduces herself as the Queen of Sheba, and Clair's party game unearths some shocking truths about her diners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Veterinary surgeon James Emson hosts the second party in Darlington, Co Durham, and decides to accompany his curry main course with a gruesome contest in which he serves up a selection of eyeballs, tongues and other bits of offal, then challenges his guests to identify which animal they came from. Diner Barry l'Anson also manages to leave the party having achieved a lifetime ambition.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Barry l'Anson hosts the third dinner party in Darlington, Co Durham, and hopes his love-themed evening will endear him to his guests. Unfortunately for him Clair Sherwood-Parkin is not impressed and begins doubting the host's masculinity, and vet James Emson is concerned what the dessert will be like. Charlotte Langley finds herself wanting a sick bag before the evening is over, and Eseyoma Sodje steals the show during some cringe-worthy entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Charlotte Langley hosts the fourth dinner party in Darlington, Co Durham, and asks her guests to attend dressed as their favourite red-carpet celebrity, but as the night progresses, she discovers she is not very good at taking criticism and a tense situation threatens to get out of hand.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Eseyoma Sodje hosts the final dinner party in Darlington, Co Durham, hoping her Nigerian recipes and a hint of glamour will impress her guests. To further improve her chances of bagging the £1,000 prize, she puts on a round of hip-hop karaoke, before the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: UEFA Euro 2017 Live
programme.sub-title: UEFA Women's Euro 2017: Netherlands v Sweden.
programme.desc: Netherlands v Sweden (Kick-off 5.00pm). Coverage of the opening quarter-final match, which takes place at Stadion De Vijverberg in Doetinchem, the Netherlands. The Dutch emerged from Group A with a 100 per cent record, so will fancy their chances against a Swedish side who have struggled to impress in this tournament so far. However, the head-to-head record between the two teams from their last six matches is evenly poised at two wins apiece. Subsequent programmes are subject to change.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: In Swaledale, mountain rescuer Pete Roe is called to Tan Hill Inn, Britain's highest pub, where a man has gone missing in freezing overnight temperatures.(n)

programme.title: Spying on the Royals
programme.desc: The conclusion of the two-part documentary about surveillance on Edward VIII and Wallis Simpson. In the wake of the abdication, the couple took a holiday in America, unaware they were being spied on by US intelligence agencies as well as British. The outbreak of the Second World War saw them move on to Lisbon, where their dealings with a known Nazi collaborator raised concerns for MI5.(n)

programme.title: The Royal House of Windsor
programme.desc: This second episode reveals how Elizabeth and her father George VI kept up appearances while crises loomed on every front. In 1947, as Britain suffered from crippling post-war austerity, the royal family set off on a tour of South Africa, but behind the smiles, the king felt the pressures of the strains of war, and anxiety about his eldest daughter. Four years after the family returned from their fraught tour, the king died, leaving a young, newly married Elizabeth to be thrust onto the throne.(n)

programme.title: Edward VIII's Murderous Mistress
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the story behind an affair Edward VIII is said to have had before becoming king and the repercussions when the woman involved later found herself in court facing the gallows. The programme investigates claims that there was a cover-up by the Establishment to protect the future king's reputation, as well as save the life of his supposed former mistress Marguerite Meller when she was charged with murdering her husband in 1923. Narrated by Rupert Penry-Jones.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, as Jon Richardson and Michelle Wolf take on guest captain Jonathan Ross with Johnny Vegas. Three-man comedy act Pappy's joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words and numbers quiz, with Lee Mack and Catherine Tate taking on Sean Lock and Miles Jupp. John Cooper Clarke joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Dougal and Ted visit the mainland, where they bump into actor Richard Wilson - and discover the hard way that he does not take kindly to being confused with his comic alter ego Victor Meldrew. Dermot Morgan and Ardal O'Hanlon star.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Key striker Father Jack drinks himself into oblivion just as the Craggy Island clerics are about to play a vital five-a-side football match against their Rugged Island rivals, led by devious Dick Byrne. Dermot Morgan stars.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, as Jon Richardson and Michelle Wolf take on guest captain Jonathan Ross with Johnny Vegas. Three-man comedy act Pappy's joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty heads on the trail of an elusive fruit - the fresh date, visiting a vast water purification plant in Israel where the raw sewage of Tel Aviv is harnessed to turn barren desert into fertile farmland. Kate Quilton flies to California to investigate why almond butter is more expensive than other nutty spreads, where she discovers a combination of extreme weather and global economics have affected the price of almonds. Plus, Matt Tebbutt makes a surprising discovery about the true origins of haggis. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp demonstrates how to create handmade and personalised gifts. She learns about sugarcraft and perfume-making, and also receives a lesson in the art of designing Victorian-style silhouettes.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help house-hunters find their dream properties in the Peak District, guiding them through the complex world of viewings and agents. Kirstie is with single mother Anne, who sold her home in Sheffield to move to the countryside with her teenage son. However, a short-term stay with her parents has turned into eight months, so Kirstie has her work cut out to find Anne a suitable property fast. Phil is with Andrea and James, who are still searching for their ideal place after two years.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps Jay and Charlene, parents to one-year-old Kai, who bought and refurbished their two bed home in Romford, Essex but now want to upsize to Chelmsford. Meanwhile, Phil Spencer assists Jemma and Graham, who returned from Los Angeles three years ago and want to settle in Southend-on-Sea.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Alex Sullivan hosts the first party in Chelmsford, Essex, hoping to impress with her birthday party-themed evening. However, an uncomfortable reunion between two former school friends gets the night off to a bad start, and a less than satisfactory dessert leaves the host with little to celebrate.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Businessman Scott Johnson hosts an `Essex Glam-themed' night for the second dinner party of the week in Chelmsford, Essex. His menu initially impresses his guests, until they realise he has taken some shortcuts with his preparations. However, a bigger problem emerges when former classmates John Mabey and Martin Young renew old hostilities, so Scott tries to lighten the mood by taking everyone for a dance in `Essex's smallest disco' - his kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Deb Croghan hosts the third dinner party in Chelmsford, Essex, and hopes to impress her guests with a tarts and vicars-style evening. Following an uncomfortable game of guessing everyone's age, she perks up the evening with an unusual entertainment - a cucumber-based sport she claims is a traditional family pastime.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Twenty-five-year-old hot-tub salesman John Mabey hosts the fourth dinner party in Chelmsford, Essex, setting out to woo his guests with a Shakespearean evening featuring an Italian-style menu, but when his food comes close to a complete fiasco, he turns to theatrics to save the day - including asking his guests to act out Romeo and Juliet.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Martin Young hosts the final dinner party in Chelmsford, Essex, hoping to impress his guests by throwing a Caribbean-themed evening. The diners are pleasantly surprised by the quality of his food and shocked when he reveals a secret talent, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Who'd a Thought It in Grafty Green, Kent, where partners Joe Mallett and Alex Rea Baldwin hope to impress their fellow guests. On arrival, Liz and Brian are excited over their two hot tubs, and Jackie and Paul are more than happy with the complimentary champagne. However, Matthew and Liam are underwhelmed by the cleanliness levels.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the New Osborne Hotel in Blackpool on their second night, where proprietor Matthew Bracegirdle and entertainment manager Liam hope their guests feel at home in their family friendly establishment. However, Jackie and Paul are unimpressed by their small room, and Joe and Alex find the cleanliness levels lacking.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the Fairy Falls Hotel in Trefriw, Conwy County Borough, where B&B newcomers Jackie and Paul Langshaw hope to impress the other contestants. They take their guests to a local maze in the afternoon and, after an uncomfortable night's sleep for Alex, some of the breakfast orders are misplaced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Husband and wife Liz and Brian Jardine welcome their guests to The Great Trewern B&B, Llandrindod Wells, Powys, where they enjoy the quiet life. Joe and Alex feel far away from it all, but the shared bathroom facilities fail to impress the other guests. At dinner, talk turns to first impressions and it appears it is all water under the bridge for Jackie and Joe, but she remains upset with the feedback Matthew and Liam gave her.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet one final time to find out what they have been paid. Joe Mallett and Alex Rea Baldwin kick things off by confronting Matthew Bracegirdle and Liam Halewood about their comments regarding the cleanliness of their establishment, and Jackie and Paul Langshaw complain about their poor breakfast score.(n)

programme.title: UEFA Euro 2017 Live
programme.sub-title: UEFA Women's Euro 2017: Austria v Spain.
programme.desc: Austria v Spain (Kick-off 5.00pm). Coverage of the third quarter-final, which takes place at Willem II Stadion in TIlburg, the Netherlands. The team to emerge victorious from this match will progress to one of the semi-finals, which are due to take place on Thursday. Subsequent programmes are subject to change.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Female Sumatran tiger Kirana faces losing her two sons, who are fully grown and being moved to other zoos to start families of their own. Indonesian dwarf buffalo Oana, one of Chester's most sensitive animals, gives birth - only for the new mum's anxiety to threaten her calf's health. Capuchin monkey Maud's eldest son Rocky is causing problems, refusing to listen to his mother's life lessons, and capybara Lochley has to rely on her mum Lilly to look after her newborn babies when she falls ill.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Four Sumatran orang-utans escape from their quarters, and tempting them back inside proves easier said than done, while the dominant female meerkat faces trouble from her daughter, who is launching physical attacks upon her mother. A young Asian elephant keeps the rest of the herd entertained as they adapt to the loss of two members to a virus. The keepers believe it needs a playmate its own age, but their hopes rest on the bull elephant mating with the females once more.(n)

programme.title: Sarah Millican: Chatterbox Live
programme.desc: Stand-up show recorded at London's Bloomsbury Theatre in 2011, in which the comedienne shares humorous insights into her life, including the perils of living alone, and offers advice on such topics as non-fattening stress relief, the alternative to marriage and the acceptable face of adultery.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas narrates another look back at TV shows from past decades, revisiting the time of revolution on the small screen in the 1980s. This edition focuses on the concept of fear, dealing with the threats of heroin, glue-sniffing and Aids, Keith Chegwin assessing the impact of video nasties and a young Jeremy Paxman discussing how to survive a nuclear war. With contributions by Joan Bakewell, Nigel Farage, Jennie Bond and Chris Tarrant.(n)

programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. programme.title: The Vikings Uncovered

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Gordon Buchanan goes in search of animals that live in snowy conditions and have adapted to survive in cold weather. The programme features polar bears raising their cubs, owls keeping their supplies of food hidden under a layer of snow, penguins that huddle together for warmth, and wolverines and ravens working alongside each other to find food. He also takes a look at the lives of animals associated with Christmas, including robins and reindeer, revealing the truth behind the story of Rudolph's red nose.(n)

programme.title: World War Three: Inside the War Room
programme.desc: Footage of a major war game with a committee of senior military, political and diplomatic figures as they confront a hypothetical `hot war' in Eastern Europe, including nuclear confrontation. Now he is forced to sleep in a hospital bed in his kitchen - but it won't be for much longer, as his old workmates team up with the DIY SOS builders and other members of the local community to adapt his home to his needs, with designer Charlie Luxton on hand to keep the boys in check.(n)

programme.title: My Tattoo Addiction
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the world of body art. Plus, Helen and Amy, whose tattoos are part of their attempt to fit into a world they believe views them as outsiders.(n)

programme.desc: Jack and the team investigate the disappearance of a woman who went missing after attending a party, and receive reports that she was last seen flirting with her boyfriend's identical twin brother. Drama, starring Anthony LaPaglia and Poppy Montgomery.(n)

programme.title: The Pacific
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the attack on Pearl Harbour, US marine sergeant John Basilone prepares to confront Japanese forces somewhere in the Pacific. Meanwhile, two young men enlist to serve for their country. Fact-based Second World War drama, depicting the experiences of US marines Robert Leckie, Eugene Sledge and John Basilone, starring James Badge Dale, Joseph Mazzello and Jon Seda.(n)

programme.title: The Pacific
programme.desc: Sgt Basilone arrives in Guadalcanal, and quickly earns the respect of his comrades for his leadership and valour in a series of skirmishes. However, a naval bombardment leads to several casualties - and when it is followed by a major assault on the airfield, Basilone and his men are pushed to the limits of their endurance as they try to defend their territory. Second World War drama, starring Jon Seda.(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: New series. Dwayne Johnson returns for the third season of the raucous sports comedy, as Spencer is sent to meet with a Vegas bigwig, casino magnate Wayne Hastings Jr, as he attempts to turn his luck around by scoring some high-profile clients to pay off his debts.(n)

programme.title: Ray Donovan
programme.desc: With the publication of Kate's story imminent, Ray begins to make plans for his family's future as he worries he could be arrested. However, if Ezra gets his way, Kate's piece will not see the light of day. Mickey, Terry and Mr Keith face trouble when trying to execute a robbery, while Ray and Mickey have a run-in when they realise that Conor is in danger. Drama, starring Liev Schreiber and Vinessa Shaw.(n)

programme.title: Ray Donovan
programme.desc: Mickey and Daryll discover their haul is significantly less than expected, but come up with a plan that sends them to the races. Meanwhile, Abby is torn between Ray and Jim. Drama, starring Liev Schreiber and Jon Voight.(n)

programme.title: Twin Peaks: The Return
programme.desc: Dale Cooper returns 25 years after his investigation into Laura Palmer's murder. Written by David Lynch and Mark Frost, and starring Kyle MacLachlan.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: A man disappears while depositing the day's takings from his wife's hair-dressing salon. Danny resists getting drawn back into his convict brother's life, and Martin prepares for his firearms qualifications test. Drama, starring Eric Close and Anthony LaPaglia.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Fish merchant Robert and his wife Kelly decide to open a seafood restaurant in Brixham - but their determinedly contemporary approach to cuisine leaves some locals unimpressed. The programme also follows the journey of a turbot over 36 hours, as it is caught and auctioned off before being served in an exclusive London restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: The cameras follow three teams of fishermen participating in Brixham's annual Trawler Race, including a father and son who have been pitted against each other. Landlady Pat Seddon is not looking forward to the raucous celebrations, however, and decides to reminisce about past race days instead. The programme also meets Matt Kimble, a graduate who gave up on his plan to become a PE teacher and decided to follow his ancestors into the fishing trade instead.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming examines the hidden histories of cities, revealing the sights and sounds rarely witnessed by the public. He begins in London at St Paul's Cathedral, where he visits a place tourists never go, before exploring a hidden park and a little-known church. He also gets a guided tour of Soho from broadcaster Danny Baker.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming tours the less-celebrated sights of Brighton, beginning by visiting the Toy and Model Museum to look at its collection of model trains. He then discovers a boutique that sells a variety of unusual items, before taking a glimpse behind the scenes at the Royal Pavilion.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming explores the history of Bristol, beginning by learning a grisly secret at the docks before meeting Mercury Prize-winning musician Roni Size to discuss life in the St Pauls and Stokes Croft areas of the city. He also explores the district of Clifton and visits a speakeasy-style bar.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: August arrives and the fishermen of Brixham spend time ashore with their families as their boats are repaired - but summer proves costly for Jan, who loses £1,000 for every day his vessel is out of action. Apprentice deckhand Logan has to decide whether a life at sea is the right choice for him and his family, and seafood seller Jenny receives a surprise on her 65th birthday.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: A history of the British Isles from ancient times to the present day, featuring re-enactments of major events and historic turning points. The series begins in 58 AD and reveals how the arrival of a 10,000-strong Roman army changed England, Scotland, Wales and Ireland for ever. The programme also explores the achievements of early Britons, including the construction of Stonehenge, and explores social structures that held sway before the invasion.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: Part two of two. Foreman is placed in isolation and given a succession of drugs as the team struggles to diagnose his illness. Frustrated by Cuddy's insistence on protocol, House takes a rat to the original victim's apartment and infects it, hoping to perform an autopsy once it sickens. However, when the animal fails to succumb, he gains information that could save his colleague. Hugh Laurie and Omar Epps star.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The team tries to unravel the symptoms of a woman who suffered a seizure in the bath and almost drowned her four-week-old son. House realises Chase has asked to be reassigned, and Wilson tells his grumpy friend that Cuddy has asked him to dinner - prompting both men to wonder about the motives behind the invitation. Hugh Laurie stars.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A girl who has developed unsettling hallucinations since surviving Hurricane Katrina is brought into the hospital by a man claiming to be her father - who House recognises from his days as a jazz musician. The medic does not believe the patient is his old friend's daughter, and wonders whether her apparent links to a famed pianist could provide a clue to her ailment. Hugh Laurie stars.(n)

programme.title: Nothing Left Unsaid: Gloria Vanderbilt & Anderson
programme.desc: Director Liz Garbus's documentary profile of wealthy American socialite Gloria Vanderbilt, who has lived in the media spotlight for more than 90 years. A candid discussion between Vanderbilt and her broadcast journalist son Anderson Cooper sheds light on Gloria's eventful life, from the custody battle between her mother and her paternal aunt that marked her childhood, through to her various marriages, parenthood, the death of her son Carter in 1988, and life as a nonagenarian.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny's investigation into a shooting draws a blank, but while working in the hospital his wife Linda overhears the victim telling a priest who was responsible. Frank enlists the help of notorious mob lawyer Angelo Gallo in a bid to prevent a hit and Jamie struggles to keep his emotions in check when he sets out to track down the person who mugged Henry. Guest starring Chazz Palminteri (The Usual Supsects).(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Two motorists are killed by a sniper and Danny's investigation leads him to a radical environmental group whose members may have been targeting drivers of gas-guzzling cars. When his son Sean sustains a serious brain injury in a bicycle accident, the detective relies on his job to get him through the tough time.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Jamie's career hangs in the balance when he responds to reports of an armed man in a tourist area and shoots the gunman dead. He must deal with the emotional consequences of his actions with the help of a psychologist, while big brother Danny conducts an investigation and soon discovers there is more to the situation than meets the eye. Elsewhere, Frank gives Erin advice on how to handle Mayor Poole on the witness stand when she must question him in a case regarding misappropriated city funds. Guest starring Annabella Sciorra (The Sopranos) and Susie Essman (Curb Your Enthusiasm).(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny is stopped by police because his car matches the description of one involved in a drug deal, and a bag of cocaine is found in the boot. He is taken into custody and the other Reagans unite to formulate a plan to get him out of the mess, but evidence mounts up that points to his guilt. Drama, starring Donnie Wahlberg.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny's investigation into a man covered in rat bites and thrown from a car leads him to the door of a powerful socialite (guest star Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio). Meanwhile, Frank looks to turn the tables on a bigoted radio host. Drama, with Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: A corrupt policeman commits suicide, raising questions that lead Rush and the team to reopen a case which Jeffries worked on several years earlier. When misplaced evidence is discovered, the detectives find themselves racing to find a murderer before an innocent man is executed.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: The case of an ambitious newspaper reporter who was murdered in 1945 is reopened when new evidence suggests she was thrown in front of a train by someone she knew. Lilly learns the journalist had several enemies, including a competitive co-worker and plenty of angry readers. Starring Kathryn Morris.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: A new witness comes forward claiming to have information about the 1984 shooting of a well-known physician, prompting Lilly to reopen the case. She is soon led into the world of gambling when it becomes apparent the respected doctor had been hiding a secret from his family. Starring Kathryn Morris.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: A rehab centre counsellor's debit card is used a year after his death, prompting the team to reopen his 2005 murder case. The victim was shot just two days before he was due to testify in court, and during the investigation, Lilly develops a strange connection to the victim - which could end up jeopardising the case. Crime drama, starring Kathryn Morris.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Expert linguist Alex Blake (Jeanne Tripplehorn, Big Love) joins the BAU, and her first case involves an escaped prisoner who has been claiming new victims, each of whom he is branding by sewing their mouths shut. The agents recognise this signature as the work of serial killer the Silencer but, curiously, the behavioural patterns are different this time round.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The agents investigate a murderer who struck in different cities within a matter of hours. One victim was a drug addict and the other a happily married mother, but both received a succession of text messages before their deaths, indicating a cryptic connection. With Kim Wayans.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The FBI profilers race against time to save members of a Kansas family who have been kidnapped and taken to a real-life house of horrors by a killer who forces them to reveal their deepest secrets to each other. Meanwhile, Beth has some game-changing news for Hotch about their relationship.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team heads to New Mexico, where a corpse has been found in the desert with both legs removed and a living victim with similar injuries turns up in a hospital. The profilers suspect they are dealing with a rogue surgeon who is selling body parts on the black market, and race to solve the case before the killer can strike again. Meanwhile, Reid's colleagues are intrigued by his phone calls to a mystery woman.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The profilers are perplexed when four men disappear in rural Oregon, and although the victims seem to have been targeted at random, the team suspects there's a hidden connection. As the investigation takes a ghoulish turn, JJ worries her work is the reason for her son's sudden loss of appetite for trick-or-treating on Halloween. With guest appearances by Anne Dudek (House) and Rebecca Wisocky (The Mentalist).(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: Rush investigates the murder of a woman in 1929, her oldest case to date, when the victim's great-granddaughter discovers the crime was never solved. programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: The team investigates a series of fake weddings and meets a Jamaican man who thought a marriage certificate would secure his place in the country. Its members also visit Glasgow where a man from Pakistan is arrested at the altar after his bride-to-be confesses she was paid to attend the ceremony.(n)

programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: A flight is delayed when a pregnant woman boards a plane to America, because immigration officers are concerned she may be planning to give birth on US soil to allow her to claim citizenship. At the British High Commission in Lagos, Nigeria, a pig farmer is questioned about the time he spent in Britain, which involved suspect travel documents and problems with the police.(n)

programme.desc: Susan Weller helps Casey with an urgent personal matter, Severide receives a tempting offer from an infamous party guy, and Stella saves a street kid from a tunnel fire.(n)
